name: Aapoph Serpentfolk
description: Aapophs possess greater strength and stronger venom than their zyss kin, but they lack zyss' intelligence and innate magic.

name: Aasimar
description: Mortals whose ancestry has been influenced by celestials are known as aasimars, and angelkin, who have blood of angels coursing through their veins, are among the most common type of them.

name: Abandoned Zealot
description: Once devout followers whose faith proved false, abandoned zealots return from the doorstep of the afterlife after being denied the eternal reward they expected.

name: Abrikandilu (Wrecker Demon)
description: Wrecker demons, also known as abrikandilus, despise beautiful things and do everything in their power to destroy both people and objects regarded as such.

name: Adachros
description: When a nascent demiplane fails to coalesce, its quintessence sometimes collapses into an adachros, a dangerous entity that combines overwhelming mental potential with no exposure to alternate viewpoints.

name: Adamantine Golem
description: Crafted from a nigh-indestructible metal of great rarity, adamantine golems can’t be destroyed except by the most powerful foes.

name: Adhukait
description: Twice as disciplined as a monk and twice as deadly as a warrior, an adhukait is the ultimate perversion of duality, two spiked asura warriors impaled together to form one ferocious, incredibly efficient killing machine.

name: Adlet
description: Adlets dwell in the farthest, harshest reaches of the Crown of the World.

name: Adult Black Dragon
description: Murderous tyrants of marshes, swamps, bogs, and fens, black dragons terrorize their domains with intense fervor.

name: Adult Blue Dragon
description: Blue dragons are the sleek and poised cosmopolitans of the chromatic dragons.

name: Adult Brass Dragon
description: Brass dragons are whimsical tricksters who delight in humor and play.

name: Adult Brine Dragon
description: Brine dragons are usually blue-green in color, with shiny scales, crests that help them glide through the water, and sweeping neck frills.

name: Adult Bronze Dragon
description: Bronze dragons are among the most common of metallic dragons and the most likely to ally with mortals on worthy quests.

name: Adult Cloud Dragon
description: At heart, cloud dragons are wanderers, explorers, and travelers who enjoy nothing more than seeing new lands and meeting unusual creatures.

name: Adult Copper Dragon
description: Capricious and always eager to share a good laugh, copper dragons are among the wiliest of the metallic dragons, but this by no means interferes with their mission to spread freedom in oppressive lands.

name: Adult Crystal Dragon
description: Good-natured but vain, crystal dragons are beautiful creatures with brilliant hides made of multicolored crystal and gemstone.

name: Adult Forest Dragon
description: Forest dragons oversee the endless growth of nature, protect it from plunder, and reclaim ruins for the wilderness.

name: Adult Gold Dragon
description: Gold dragons are the epitome of metallic dragonkind, unrivaled in their strength as well as their wisdom.

name: Adult Green Dragon
description: Green dragons are the most contemplative of the chromatic dragons as well as the most approachable.

name: Adult Magma Dragon
description: Magma dragons have a reputation among other dragons for being unpredictable and brash.

name: Adult Red Dragon
description: The largest and most powerful of the chromatic dragons, red dragons are a menace to civilizations everywhere, and their strength is rivaled only by their arrogance.

name: Adult Sea Dragon
description: Sea dragons' affinity with water grants them mastery over rain, storms, and floods.

name: Adult Silver Dragon
description: Silver dragons are among the most chivalrous of all dragonkind; they wield frost and cold as weapons, can walk on clouds, and dwell high upon snowy mountain peaks or deep in steep, misty valleys.

name: Adult Sky Dragon
description: Sky dragons live above the clouds near the summits of mountains.

name: Adult Sovereign Dragon
description: The most well-known of imperial dragons due to their deep involvement with mortals, the sovereign dragons' name comes from their mandate of selecting rulers—but at some point, the dragons themselves joined the list of worthy candidates.

name: Adult Umbral Dragon
description: While the other primal dragons hail from the Elemental Planes, the cruel and unceasingly malicious umbral dragons originate in the depths of the Shadow Plane.

name: Adult Underworld Dragon
description: Underworld dragons embody the pressure between tectonic plates, the heat behind geysers, and flash fires that ignite when the conditions are just right.

name: Adult White Dragon
description: The most feral and least intelligent of all the chromatic dragons, white dragons are brutish, predatory, and chiefly motivated by self-preservation.

name: Agradaemon (Conflagration Daemon)
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 79
description: Equal parts lion, spider, and demagogue, agradaemons are born from the forge-flames of Szuriel, Horseman of War.

name: Ahuizotl
description: The ahuizotl is a vicious, semi-aquatic predator that resembles a hideous cross between a badger and an otter, with disturbingly web-fingered paws supplemented by a fifth hand at the end of a long, serpentine tail.

name: Ahvothian
description: Ahvothians are feral and cunning fiends from an Abyssal realm of jungles, dinosaurs, and relentless brutality.

name: Air Mephit
description: Air mephits are capricious and flighty relative to their kin; they are as likely to fly blindly into battle as they are to whine in terror at a loud noise.

name: Air Wisp
description: Air wisps are floating spheres of cloud and storm, perpetually humming a light, whispery tone.

name: Aiudara Wraith
description: Dahak’s influence in Alseta’s Landing created a soul-draining effect that slays unprotected creatures within, transforming them into ghostly creatures known as aiudara wraiths, but these rare undead can rise within modern aiudara portals as well.

name: Akata
description: An akata is a hairless, blue-skinned quadruped with fearsome jaws, glowing eyes, a pair of thin tails, and a mane of writhing tentacles.

name: Akizendri
description: Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths.

name: Alchemical Golem
description: This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds.

name: Alghollthu Master (Aboleth)
description: Aboleths form the core of alghollthu society, and while they are the “common folk” of their own societies, they see themselves as masters of all others.

name: Aluum Enforcer
source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 82
description: The most common aluum is powered by the bound soul of a loyal city servant, but its creation is among the Pactmasters’ most guarded secrets.

name: Amalgamite
description: Teleportation magic can prove a difficult undertaking, even for experienced spellcasters.

name: Ammut
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 77
description: These chimeric, desert-dwelling fiends have massive bodies that are part hippopotamus, part large cat, and part crocodile.

name: Amoeba Swarm
description: An amoeba swarm consists of thousands of individual single-celled organisms held together by acrid-smelling slime.

name: Amphisbaena
description: An amphisbaena is an exceedingly aggressive, venomous viper of remarkable size that bears two heads—one on each end of its body.

name: Anadi Elder
description: Anadi elders must make the difficult decision of whether to continue negotiations or to escalate a disagreement to outright conflict.

name: Anadi Hunter
description: Anadi hunters act as the eyes and ears of their clans, scouting the surrounding area for potential invaders.

name: Anadi Sage
description: Anadi sages commune with nature and hone their magic through practice.

name: Anancus
description: The anancus is an ancient species of elephant with unusually long tusks and a trunk shorter than its more modern cousins.

name: Ancient Black Dragon
description: Murderous tyrants of marshes, swamps, bogs, and fens, black dragons terrorize their domains with intense fervor.

name: Ancient Blue Dragon
description: Blue dragons are the sleek and poised cosmopolitans of the chromatic dragons.

name: Ancient Brass Dragon
description: Brass dragons are whimsical tricksters who delight in humor and play.

name: Ancient Brine Dragon
description: Brine dragons are usually blue-green in color, with shiny scales, crests that help them glide through the water, and sweeping neck frills.

name: Ancient Bronze Dragon
description: Bronze dragons are among the most common of metallic dragons and the most likely to ally with mortals on worthy quests.

name: Ancient Cloud Dragon
description: At heart, cloud dragons are wanderers, explorers, and travelers who enjoy nothing more than seeing new lands and meeting unusual creatures.

description: Capricious and always eager to share a good laugh, copper dragons are among the wiliest of the metallic dragons, but this by no means interferes with their mission to spread freedom in oppressive lands.

name: Ancient Crystal Dragon
description: Good-natured but vain, crystal dragons are beautiful creatures with brilliant hides made of multicolored crystal and gemstone.

name: Ancient Forest Dragon
description: Forest dragons oversee the endless growth of nature, protect it from plunder, and reclaim ruins for the wilderness.

name: Ancient Gold Dragon
description: Gold dragons are the epitome of metallic dragonkind, unrivaled in their strength as well as their wisdom.

name: Ancient Green Dragon
description: Green dragons are the most contemplative of the chromatic dragons as well as the most approachable.

name: Ancient Magma Dragon
description: Magma dragons have a reputation among other dragons for being unpredictable and brash.

name: Ancient Red Dragon
description: The largest and most powerful of the chromatic dragons, red dragons are a menace to civilizations everywhere, and their strength is rivaled only by their arrogance.

name: Ancient Sea Dragon
description: Sea dragons' affinity with water grants them mastery over rain, storms, and floods.

name: Ancient Silver Dragon
description: Silver dragons are among the most chivalrous of all dragonkind; they wield frost and cold as weapons, can walk on clouds, and dwell high upon snowy mountain peaks or deep in steep, misty valleys.

name: Ancient Sky Dragon
description: Sky dragons live above the clouds near the summits of mountains.

name: Ancient Sovereign Dragon
description: The most well-known of imperial dragons due to their deep involvement with mortals, the sovereign dragons' name comes from their mandate of selecting rulers—but at some point, the dragons themselves joined the list of worthy candidates.

name: Ancient Umbral Dragon
description: While the other primal dragons hail from the Elemental Planes, the cruel and unceasingly malicious umbral dragons originate in the depths of the Shadow Plane.

name: Ancient Underworld Dragon
description: Underworld dragons embody the pressure between tectonic plates, the heat behind geysers, and flash fires that ignite when the conditions are just right.

name: Ancient White Dragon
description: The most feral and least intelligent of all the chromatic dragons, white dragons are brutish, predatory, and chiefly motivated by self-preservation.

name: Android Infiltrator
description: Androids possess synthetic bodies inhabited by living souls.

name: Angazhani
description: Angazhanis lurk in the depths of the world's jungles, where these sapient, four-armed apes prey on any creatures they deem lesser than themselves.

name: Angheuvore
description: Angheuvores, or mortic elves, have an insatiable hunger for raw humanoid flesh— though they're reluctant to feed on other elves.

name: Animate Dream
description: An animate dream coalesces from centuries of stray fragments of reverie and dream left behind as slumbering minds drift through the Dimension of Dreams.

name: Animated Armor
description: Suits of animated armor see use both as guardians and as training partners in high-end martial academies able to afford the extravagance.

name: Animated Broom
description: Animated brooms perform menial tasks of cleaning and upkeep, but they can step in to defend a room from intrusion if needed.

name: Animated Colossus
description: Animating a 100-foot-tall statue is worth the cost for spellcasters guarding immense dungeons.

name: Animated Furnace
description: This huge forge or oven is animated to protect a workspace or kitchen, travel alongside its owner, or both.

name: Animated Silverware Swarm
description: Nobles are known to pay great amounts to animate their silverware, both for ease in cleaning and to serve as novelties during dinner parties.

name: Animated Statue
description: Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire.

name: Animated Trebuchet
description: Large armies sometimes pay exorbitant fees to animate their siege weapons.

name: Ankhrav
description: These horse-sized, burrowing monsters generally avoid heavily settled areas like cities, but ankhravs’ predilection for livestock and humanoid flesh ensures that the creatures do not remain in the deep wilderness for long.

name: Ankou
description: Ankous are shadowy killers who serve powerful fey creatures, or even the Eldest— the demigods of the First World.

name: Ankylosaurus
description: Squat, heavily armored quadrupeds, ankylosauruses are stubborn and irascible.

name: Annis Hag
description: Annis hags are brutal torturers and murderers, delighting in the musical screams and tasty flesh of young creatures and those who are pure of heart.

name: Aolaz
description: Aolazes are great beasts carved from stone and metal and magically imbued with the essence of life.

name: Aphorite
description: The denizens of the Eternal City of Axis first forged aphorites to serve as emissaries, agents, and facilitators, with one foot in the sublime, perfect order of the Plane of Law, and one in the messy, murky, confusing muck of the Material Plane.

name: Ararda
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 79
description: Shaitans corrupted by the Black Desert's blightburn become scorpion-like arardas.

name: Arbiter
description: These spherical inevitables are scouts and diplomats.

name: Arboreal Archive
description: Arboreal archives are solitary beings typically found in the remote wilderness.

name: Arboreal Reaper
description: While some forests have an idyllic, peaceful quality to them, others feel distinctly unfriendly or even sinister—these forests are the favored haunts of arboreal reapers.

name: Arboreal Regent
description: Arboreal regents—also called treants—are lumbering, solitary creatures responsible for guarding an entire forest.

name: Arboreal Warden
description: Arboreal wardens are the rangers of arboreal society.

name: Army Ant Swarm
description: An army ant swarm is a terrifying carpet of stinging insects that devours all in its path.

name: Asanbosam
description: Asanbosams are monstrous, hairy humanoids with cold iron fangs and muscular limbs that end in powerful, hooked claws.

name: Assassin Vine
description: The assassin vine is a carnivorous plant with a voracious appetite.

name: Astradaemon (Void Daemon)
description: These unnerving, almost reptilian daemons represent death by direct assault against a soul or life-force—the same numbing death they bring with their fell touch.

name: Astral Deva (Emissary Angel)
description: Astral devas are the elite messengers and emissaries of the celestial realms, serving deities and celestial armies by delivering messages, performing reconnaissance, and providing support for those in need of aid.

name: Athach
description: The towering and brutish giants known as athaches are reviled for both their monstrosity and their cruelty.

name: Attic Whisperer
description: Beware the haunting sobs of the attic whisperer, for they carry the pained wrath of an abandoned child who perished due to the neglect or absence of their caretakers.

name: Augnagar
description: The brutish and gluttonous augnagar live to feast— preferably on rotten flesh, and when possible, demon flesh.

name: Augur
description: These spherical knots of sinewy muscle, serrated blades, and bloody metal are the most common velstracs on the Shadow Plane.

name: Aurumvorax
description: Aurumvoraxes are highly aggressive and territorial predators that sprint on eight legs, using their terrific strength and iron-hard claws to dig through solid stone.

name: Avarek
description: Avareks delight in tormenting ship's crews and causing shipwrecks off the coasts of Garund and the Inner Sea.

name: Awakened Tree
description: Arboreal regents and other wielders of powerful primal magic grant temporary sentience to trees in order to protect the forest.

name: Axiomite
description: According to the axiomites, their kind rose from the raw mathematical underpinnings of the universe, manifesting as great builders who created the ancient, colossal cities of the Outer Planes and gave life to the mechanical inevitables.

name: Azarketi Explorer
description: This rakish azarketi explores the wrecks and ruins of the Inner Sea's coasts.

name: Azer
description: Azers are an elemental people living on the Plane of Fire, often crudely described by mortals as brassy dwarves.

name: Azure Worm
description: The azure worm is a deep-blue creature that is more at home in flooded tunnels than dry caves.

name: Azuretzi
description: Azuretzis are sinuous, serpentine creatures with dagger-sharp teeth, covered in brilliant blue scales with mottled purple and pink highlights that shimmer in a pareidolic approximation of leering, laughing faces.

name: Baatamidar
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 76
description: Baatamidars are drawn to destroy planar communities on the fringes where the Outer Planes touch the chaos of the Maelstrom.

name: Babau (Blood Demon)
description: The babau is an assassin, a murderer, and a sadist—certainly not unusual traits, yet their penchant for stealth and surprise sets them apart from their kin.

name: Badger
description: The typical badger has dark, brownish-gray fur highlighted with white markings, particularly on the head, giving it a striped mask of fur around its eyes.

name: Balisse (Confessor Angel)
description: Balisses, or confessor angels, seek to assist mortals ensnared by moral dilemmas or crises of faith.

name: Ball Python
description: This nonvenomous snake’s name comes from its tendency to curl into a ball when frightened, though most people know it for its hunting tactic of coiling around prey and crushing victims with its powerful muscles.

name: Balor (Fire Demon)
description: When folk whisper frightened tales of the demonic, what most envision is the balor—a towering figure of fire and flesh, a horned nightmare armed with a flaming whip and a sword flying through the night in search of its latest victim.

name: Banshee
description: Banshees are the furious, tormented souls of elves bound to the Material Plane by a betrayal that defined the final hours of their lives.

name: Baobhan Sith
description: Undeath is rare in the fey realm of the First World, for that plane's infusion with the raw power of life makes undead uncomfortable at best.

name: Baomal
description: Few sea monsters are as dreaded and feared as the two-headed baomal.

name: Barbazu (Bearded Devil)
description: Barbazus, known also as bearded devils or infantry devils, are murderous fiends who satiate their lust for annihilation by serving as the foot soldiers of Hell’s armies, often leading hordes of lesser devils such as imps and lemures into battle.

name: Barghest
description: Typical barghests are ravenous gluttons of life who feed and grow on the fat of mortals, their bodies changing in ways none can predict as they use the flesh and blood of their victims to achieve grisly transformations into greater barghests.

name: Barnacle Ghoul
description: Far more powerful and dangerous than most ghouls, barnacle ghouls are the risen corpses of veteran sailors who fell overboard or of bloodthirsty pirates who died from keelhauling.

name: Basidirond
description: The basidirond, also called a mindfrond, is a fungal creature that crawls about on woody tendrils.

name: Basilisk
description: The basilisk is an eight-legged reptile with a nasty disposition and the ability to turn creatures to stone with its gaze.

name: Bastion Archon
description: The mightiest of archon-kind form in the heat of battle from incredibly uncommon circumstances.

name: Bauble Beast
description: The reclusive and deceptive creatures called bauble beasts create false jewelry as a byproduct of their extremely bizarre magical digestive systems.

name: Baykok
description: A baykok is the restless remnant of a warrior or hunter, cast out for evil acts and cursed to forever soar through the sky far from its home, unable to ever set foot on the ground again.

name: Bebilith
description: While demons control much of the Abyss, even they are hunted in the wilder regions of this horrific plane.

name: Behemoth Hippopotamus
description: Behemoth hippopotamuses stand taller than elephants.

name: Behir
description: The behir is a massive, serpentine beast with never fewer than a dozen short legs, each ending in three hooked talons.

name: Belker
description: These reclusive elementals have glowing red eyes, leathery wings, and long, sharp claws.

name: Betobeto-San
description: A betobeto-san wanders the highways and byways of the Material Plane, searching for unwilling traveling companions to sustain the spirit's appetite for fear.

name: Bida
description: Bidas are black-scaled dragons with long, serpentine bodies and bat-like wings.

name: Biloko Veteran
description: A biloko who has led a sufficient number of successful hunts garners the respect (and fear) of their companions.

name: Biloko Warrior
description: Rank-and-file bilokos stalk the jungles in small hunting bands.

name: Binumir
source: Pathfinder #157: Devil at the Dreaming Palace pg. 82
description: Whenever two individuals who share a strong emotional bond perish together, they might rise as a combined spirit known as a binumir.

name: Bison
description: Bison are large bovines with short faces and two horns; they weigh an upwards of 2,000 pounds and stand up to 6 feet at the withers.

name: Black Bear
description: Contrary to the name, black bears can be cinnamon or even blond in coloration, depending on which hue is most beneficial for surviving in their local environment.

name: Black Pudding
description: Most often found below ground, these oozes scour caves for objects to dissolve with their corrosive secretions.

name: Black Scorpion
description: With a carapace the color of polished obsidian and a penchant for attacking villages, this humongous scorpion is one of the desert's most frightening predators.

name: Blindheim
description: Inhabitants of damp, subterranean caves, blindheims resemble stubby humanoids with oversized, frog-like heads and bulbous eyes.

name: Blink Dog
description: At first glance, blink dogs seem to be little more than long-eared, bearded canines with tawny coats.

name: Blizzardborn
description: Freezing and thawing in a near-constant loop, blizzardborn resemble humanoid forms composed of a mixture of partially melted snow and sleet.

name: Blodeuwedd
description: The mysterious blodeuwedds dwell in those parts of the world where the boundaries between the Material Plane and the First World have worn thin, or around portals between the two planes.

name: Blood Boar
description: Blood boars are fearsome swine bred in Cheliax for the singular purpose of hunting down escaped slaves.

name: Blood Hag
description: Blood hags, also known as soucouyants, infiltrate communities in the guise of young, innocent humanoids.

name: Blood Ooze
description: Swelling like a bubble about to burst, this oozing thing looks like it is made entirely from blood.

name: Blood Painter
description: Simultaneously enamored with the natural world yet too alien to survive in it, blood painters are eight-limbed artists who stalk, kill, and dismember in search of pigment and sustenance alike.

name: Bloodlash Bush
description: What first appears to be a simple shrub suddenly stirs to life.

name: Bloodseeker
description: Scourges of swamps and damp, abandoned places, bloodseekers are ravenous blood drinkers.

name: Blue-Ringed Octopus
description: While relatively small, the blue-ringed octopus is particularly venomous for its size.

name: Boar
description: Boars are omnivorous mammals, hunted heavily because their meat is considered a delicacy.

name: Bodak
description: When a living, sentient humanoid is exposed to an extreme expression of supernatural evil, the experience can irrevocably damn the victim, crushing their mind and ripping out their soul in an appalling, unholy transformation that results in a creature that's anathema to life—the bodak.

name: Bog Mummy
description: The cultural practice of mummifying the dead is not the only way a body can become preserved, nor is it the only route that gives rise to these disease-spreading undead monstrosities.

name: Bog Strider
description: The insectile bog striders call themselves seshes, but they take no offense at those who use the more common vernacular to refer to them.

name: Bogey
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 78
description: A bogey typically hunts a single creature at a time, usually a small child or elderly person, methodically stalking and tormenting their prey.

name: Bogeyman
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 79
description: These nocturnal stalkers tail their chosen quarry for days, even weeks at a time, ominously showing up in back alleys, shadowy street corners, and even in victims’ own homes before going in for the kill.

name: Boggard Scout
description: Often tasked with patrolling the borders of their lands, boggard scouts learn to speak another language (typically Common) to make it easier to issue threats and insults toward trespassers.

name: Boggard Swampseer
description: The boggard swampseer has been gifted with magic through its worship of the demon lord Gogunta, and uses its power to rule a boggard village, keeping the rest of the village in line and planning raids on nearby communities.

name: Boggard Warrior
description: Boggard warriors exalt in single combat, and prefer to fight alone so that none can contest their kills.

name: Bone Croupier
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 80
description: For many, gambling is just fun and games, but for some, it can become a bad habit or even a life-consuming addiction.

name: Bone Prophet
description: The speakers for the dead known as bone prophets hold an esteemed place as voices for their decapitated god.

name: Bone Ship
description: Rarely does anything living remain after a bone ship's passing—only death, destruction, and waves red as blood that clash and foam in its wake.

name: Bone Skipper Swarm
description: A large swarm of bone skippers can reduce a human skeleton into dry, brittle fragments in a matter of hours.

name: Bore Worm Swarm
description: A single finger-length bore worm is unpleasant but mostly innocuous.

name: Bottlenose Dolphin
description: The bottlenose dolphin is the most common and widespread species of dolphin.

name: Brain Collector
description: The grotesque brain collectors (or neh-thalggus, as they call themselves) originate from worlds far beyond the known solar system, and are part of a conglomeration of hostile aliens known collectively as the Dominion of the Black.

name: Brainchild
description: A rumor can become so vivid and so persistent that it comes to life, creating a brainchild—a living illusion that hatches from an intense belief in a remorseless and implacable killer.

name: Bralani (Wind Azata)
description: Bralanis embody the freedom of fair competition, embracing opportunities to test their skills against worthy foes and bring mortals together with the thrill of good-natured sports and contests.

name: Bregdi
description: Bregdis hunt warm-blooded prey, lurking in the waters of most major port cities before using their ray-like bodies and hooked claws to hitch onto the underside of boats pulling into port.

name: Bright Walker
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 78
description: Those who encounter calignis quickly learn that their deaths involve burning out instead of bleeding out.

name: Brimorak (Arson Demon)
description: These goat-headed demons have glowing red eyes and flaming hooves but measure only about 3 feet in height.

name: Brine Shark
description: Brine sharks are deadly elementals that roam the endless oceans of the Plane of Water.

name: Brontosaurus
description: Brontosauruses are truly gigantic behemoths, plodding herbivores large enough to be unafraid of all but the most massive predators.

name: Brood Leech Swarm
description: Most smaller species of leeches do not tend to swarm, but brood leeches are prone to gathering in seething, undulant mats of squirming gluttony.

name: Brownie
description: Brownies make their homes in the trunks of hollow trees, small earthy burrows, and even under porches or within the crawl spaces of farmhouses.

name: Brughadatch (Midlife Brughadatch)
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 78
description: The biggest difference between a gahlepod and a grown brughadatch isn’t their humanoid appearance, but the powerful magic they gain as they mature.

name: Bugaboo
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 78
description: After devouring enough souls, a bogey transforms into the more powerful and sophisticated bugaboo.

name: Bugbear Thug
description: The more common bugbear thug specializes in the art of lurking in the shadows.

name: Bugbear Tormentor
description: The bugbear tormentor seeks to torture their prey as much through psychological intimidation as through physical harm.

name: Bugul Noz
description: This gangly fey humanoid wanders the overgrown paths of dark, misty forests, voluntarily isolating themself in an attempt to protect others from their hideous form.

name: Bulette
description: Bulettes are fearsome predators that roam just beneath the surface of desolate wilderness areas.

name: Bunyip
description: Bunyips are dangerous aquatic predators that resemble a cross between a shark and a seal.

name: Buso
description: Busos are tree-dwelling folk with a simmering desire to consume the flesh of others.

name: Bythos
description: The bythos is a guardian of space and time, and at all times seeks out those who misuse planar and temporal magic.

name: Cacodaemon (Harvester Daemon)
description: These embodiments of demented violence and spite are spawned from eddies of angry and warped souls amid Abaddon’s mists.

name: Cactus Leshy
description: These little plants are known for their nettlesome attitude.

name: Cairn Linnorm
description: Cairn linnorms are disturbing, even by linnorm standards.

name: Cairn Wight
description: Jealous guardians of tombs, barrows, and sepulchers, cairn wights usually spawn from necromantic rituals.

name: Calathgar
description: Calathgars are mysterious predatory plants that grow in the depths of the densest frozen forests, realms where icicles rarely melt from snow-cloaked trees.

name: Caligni Caller
description: Although the mysterious demigods known as the Forsaken disappeared eons ago, many calignis continue to follow their ancient traditions of worship.

name: Caligni Creeper
description: The most widespread of the caligni are the mischievous caligni creepers.

name: Caligni Dancer
description: Caligni dancers serve as intermediaries between caligni clans.

name: Caligni Slayer
description: Caligni slayers possess greater occult talents than others of their kind.

name: Caligni Stalker
description: Caligni stalkers are often leaders of caligni enclaves.

name: Caligni Vanguard
description: Caligni children born without eyes—an extremely rare occurrence—are considered sacred to their communities.

name: Calikang
source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 84
description: The calikangs are giant blue-skinned, six-armed guardians of ancient tombs and treasuries.

name: Calikang
description: Calikangs are giant, blue-skinned, six-armed guardians of ancient tombs and treasuries.

name: Camarach
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 77
description: Planar travel is at best imprecise, yet still too predictable for the erratic nature of the Maelstrom.

name: Camel
description: For generations untold, nomads and traders have relied on sure-footed camels to cross the harsh deserts and trackless wastes around the world.

name: Carbuncle
description: Never have legend and misinformation met upon a more inauspicious brow than that of the lowly carbuncle.

name: Carnivorous Blob
description: Carnivorous blobs are the ravenous spawn of shattered worlds far beyond the stars, born across the galaxy in inert form until they fall like meteorites onto unsuspecting worlds.

name: Carnivorous Crystal
source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 76
description: Carnivorous crystals are strange ooze creatures native to the Plane of Earth.

name: Carrion Golem
description: Carrion golems are foul-smelling and fly-swarmed amalgams of putrefied parts stitched together from many different creatures.

name: Cassisian (Archive Angel)
description: The weakest of angels, cassisians usually serve as lackey messengers for more powerful angels or as spiritual guides for mortals.

name: Cat Sith
description: Cat siths can easily pass for common black house cats, noteworthy only for the white spots on their chests and their unusually bristly personalities.

name: Catfolk Pouncer
description: Catfolk pouncers travel the world in search of new experiences.

name: Catoblepas
description: The catoblepas is an aggressive beast at the best of times.

name: Catrina
description: Not all spirits who enter the Boneyard realize they have died.

name: Caulborn
description: Telepathic prophets and historians, caulborn gather in small cabals for protection and camaraderie, using their collective brainpower to unravel cosmic conundrums.

name: Cauthooj
description: These large, flightless birds are deceptively agile, considering their long bodies and awkward, hopping gait.

name: Cavalry Brigade
description: A cavalry brigade consists of several Hellknights and a single field-maralictor, in the distinctive armor of their order and bearing lances; the maralictor speaks for the brigade, questioning travelers the brigade encounters and barking orders.

name: Cave Bear
description: Larger, stronger, and far more aggressive than its smaller cousins, the cave bear is a behemoth that avoids civilized lands, preferring to dwell in remote places.

name: Cave Fisher
description: Cave fishers lurk in dark corners near the ceilings of caves and underground structures, lying in wait for prey to approach.

name: Cave Giant
description: Cave giants are the vicious loners of the giant world.

name: Cave Scorpion
description: Cave scorpions prefer to reside in underground lairs.

name: Cavern Troll
description: Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path—even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce.

name: Cecaelia Trapper
description: Cecaelias resemble humans with octopus tentacles instead of legs.

name: Centaur
description: Centaurs are legendary hunters and trackers who resemble heavily muscled humans with the bodies of powerful horses from the waist down.

name: Centipede Swarm
description: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes.

name: Ceustodaemon (Guardian Daemon)
description: Ceustodaemons are formed from the souls of vile mortals, particularly those who took efforts to hasten their own death, their willingness shaping them into daemonic servants.

name: Changeling Exile
description: This changeling exile is the child of a night hag or dreamthief hag.

name: Charau-ka Acolyte of Angazhan
description: Even with the Gorilla King’s fall, some charau-kas still worship Angazhan.

name: Charau-ka Butcher
description: While charau-kas are well known for their brutality, some frighten even others of their kind with their obsession with violence.

name: Charau-ka Warrior
description: A charau-ka warrior carries hatchets, daggers, and similar weaponry on their person and usually doesn’t worry about running out of thrown weapons when rocks plucked from the ground are just as deadly in their hands.

name: Chernobue
description: The chernobue infects all creatures it encounters with itself, spreading pain and calamity wherever it flops and writhes.

name: Chimera
description: The chimera is the archetypal example of an unnatural monster made up of a monstrous mix of wildly different component creatures: in this case, a lion, a dragon, and a goat.

name: Chimpanzee Visitant
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 83
description: Common circus animals viewed as expendable by their caretakers are perhaps the most likely to rise as visitants.

name: Choker
description: With long, cartilaginous limbs and gray skin, chokers easily hide in stony alcoves, rocky fissures, and darkened staircases to ambush their prey.

name: Choral (Choir Angel)
description: Choral angels are incredible singers who fill the halls of Nirvana with pious chants and sacred hymns.

name: Chouchin-Obake
description: A chouchin-obake takes the shape of a paper lantern with a horizontal split near the bottom from which a long tongue protrudes.

name: Chupacabra
description: These notorious predators have an undeniable thirst for blood.

name: Chuul
description: Also known as chu'ulothis, these large, armor-plated, crustacean predators lurk beneath the surface of pools, mires, and ponds, waiting to snatch up prey with their massive claws before paralyzing them with their tentacles.

name: Chyzaedu
description: Chyzaedus' home world was consumed millennia ago by the Dominion of the Black via the manipulation of a black hole.

name: Cinder Rat
description: These oversized rodents are made of smoldering charcoal and elemental fire, and noxious fumes continually bellow from their flaming flesh.

name: City Guard
description: Most towns and cities on Golarion have a garrison of professional guards whose duties include patrolling the streets, assisting citizenry in need, and acting as a quick military response in times of crisis.

name: Clacking Skull Swarm
description: Roiling about in seething waves of bleached death, clacking skull swarms arise from the remains of dozens of beheaded humanoids.

name: Clay Golem
description: Traditionally, clay golems are crafted in the image of a deity and used as guardians of tombs or sacred crypts.

name: Cloaker
description: Weird and paranoid creatures that dwell in the Darklands, cloakers resemble hideous, flying manta rays.

name: Clockwork Amalgam
source: Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale pg. 81
description: A clockwork amalgam is a powerful construct created by applying magic to a collection of interchangeable internal mechanisms.

name: Clockwork Assassin
source: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven pg. 82
description: Exceptionally efficient and utterly merciless, clockwork assassins carry out their murderous directives with mechanical precision.

name: Clockwork Dragon
description: Clockwork dragons are a marvel of clockwork design.

name: Clockwork Mage
description: A clockwork mage is a lethal blend of magic and machinery.

name: Clockwork Soldier
description: These diligent machines guard their assigned posts tirelessly.

name: Clockwork Spy
description: Engineers, technologists, and mechanically gifted wizards employ clockwork spies—tiny, spiderlike constructs capable of recording and playing back audio— to surreptitiously surveil their enemies or steal secrets from competitors.

name: Cloud Giant
description: The graceful and regal cloud giants have skin of milky white to powdery blue.

name: Cobbleswarm
description: Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

name: Cockatrice
description: Ugly and aggressive, the dread cockatrice stalks garbage pits and hillside dumps in search of prey that it can turn to stone with its petrifying beak and subsequently consume piece by broken piece.

name: Cockroach Swarm
description: While cockroaches tend to gather in cramped spaces, a disturbed colony is sometimes prone to swarming, where hundreds or even thousands of the insects scurry out of their hiding places in a raft of shiny brown and black carapaces on thousands of skittering legs.

name: Coil Spy
description: Some serpentfolk undergo intense ritual training and practice to improve their innate ability to disguise themselves.

name: Common Eurypterid
description: The smallest of the giant eurypterids can grow to about the size of a large dog.

name: Compsognathus
description: The compsognathus is a small bipedal dinosaur that moves in swift, darting motions.

name: Consonite Choir
description: Floods of crystalline blades called consonite choirs surge through the caverns and tunnels of the Plane of Earth.

name: Coral Capuchin
description: A coral capuchin resembles a hairless pink monkey with large eyes and batlike wings.

name: Cornugon (Horned Devil)
description: Hell's armies contain legions upon legions of different devils all suited precisely to their roles.

name: Corpselight
description: A will-o'-wisp that starves to death might rise as a cold, blue, glowing sphere of spongy wetness—a corpselight.

name: Corrupted Relic
description: Creatures that once held particular items dear can be bound to them after death, their souls inhabiting the item from within.

name: Counteflora
description: The counteflora resembles an oversized dandelion with black flowers and sinister patterns on its bracts, which it can contract for additional protection and to turn its flower head into a deadly bashing weapon.

name: Crag Linnorm
description: Despite being among the weakest linnorms, the crag linnorm is a devastating predator, capable of quickly cooking its foes with its magma breath.

name: Crawling Hand
description: A crawling hand formed from the appendage of a Medium creature is quick and agile, skittering in the shadows until it can strike its prey.

name: Crimson Worm
description: Among the most dangerous cave worms are the fiery crimson worms.

name: Crocodile
description: Crocodiles can be found basking on riverbanks, lurking in swamps, or floating in lakes.

name: Crossroads Guardian
description: When a village is threatened by a horde of bandits but there's no one to help, when a monastery's divine relic must be guarded but the last monk is on their deathbed, when the world can be saved only through the use of an artifact no one alive remembers, nature responds by creating a crossroads guardian, a naturally occurring entity of primal magic.

name: Crucidaemon (Torture Daemon)
source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 85
description: Of all the ways to die, crucidaemons represent perhaps one of the least desirable: death by torture.

name: Cu Sith
description: Cu siths are hound-like doorkeepers of remote portals to other planes, particularly portals to the untamed realm of the fey, the First World.

name: Culdewen
description: Perpetually cursed to hunger and failure, a culdewen plies waterways in search of appealing fish to catch—the bigger the better.

name: Cunning Guide
description: Spirit guides of cunning are often seen as the weakest of the spirit guides, but are also the most numerous and proactive, guiding families to safe paths or leaving food and water for warriors.

name: Cyclops
description: The kingdoms of the cyclopes date to an age before the rise of humanity, when dragons and giants and serpentfolk ruled the world.

name: Cythnigot
description: The cythnigot is a foul fungal parasite that grows and thrives in the corpses of small creatures.

name: Daeodon
description: Where the typical boar is merely ill-tempered and generally unfriendly, the towering daeodon is legitimately hateful and ruthlessly violent.

name: Dalos
source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 77
description: Dalos are reclusive fey that dwell within or near remote volcanoes and volcanic vents and resemble the massive calderas they call home.

name: Danava Titan
description: Danava titans once regulated the foundational forces that shaped reality.

name: Dandasuka
description: Known as “biters” among the more powerful rakshasa castes, dandasukas serve as spies and assassins for rakshasa clans or powerful spellcasters who have found methods to bind one of these fiends to their will.

name: Dark Naga
description: Dark nagas are wicked, jealous creatures that crave power and wealth.

name: Deadly Mantis
description: These gigantic mantids make their homes within deep jungles and prehistoric forests where they hunt and devour equally massive prey.

name: Deculi
source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 78
description: These batlike monstrosities inhabit the nooks and crevices of the Darklands, where they hang from stalactites and swoop down on unsuspecting prey.

name: Deep Gnome Rockwarden
description: Deep gnome rockwardens follow druidic teachings and commune with the natural elemental influences and denizens of the Darklands.

name: Deep Gnome Scout
description: Deep gnome scouts patrol the tunnels that lead into their settlements.

name: Deep Gnome Warrior
description: Deep gnome warriors are quick to charge into battle but focus on defending their kin and their homes over more aggressive tactics when a choice is available.

name: Deepwater Dhuthorex
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 80
description: The typical dhuthorex is a dumb and hungry beast, chasing prey through the depths and venturing onto land only to pursue easy prey.

name: Deghuun (Children Of Mhar)
description: Mhar, an ancient evil deity of caverns, mountains, and volcanoes, belongs to the pantheon of the Great Old Ones—monstrous beings of alien intellect and unfathomable power.

name: Deimavigga (Apostate Devil)
description: As masters of cold, calculated logic and perfectly timed proselytization, the loathsome deimaviggas seek to set friend against friend and turn the faithful from their beliefs at every opportunity.

name: Deinonychus
description: Deinonychuses are wily hunters that attack in groups of up to a dozen individuals, ripping apart their prey with sharp talons and powerful jaws.

name: Deinosuchus
description: The deinosuchus is a primeval relative of the crocodile, and is an enormous predator capable of catching and eating dinosaurs that wander too close to its domain!Recall Knowledge - Animal (Nature): DC 26DeinosuchusCreature 9NHugeAnimalSource Bestiary pg.

name: Demilich
description: Demiliches are formed when a lich, through carelessness or by accident, loses its phylactery.

name: Denizen of Leng
description: Slavers and raiders from the cold, windswept dimension of Leng, these malevolent humanoids range across reality in ominous black ships capable of sailing beyond the borders of dimensions and planes.

name: Derghodaemon (Ravager Daemon)
description: Derghodaemons represent death through unfathomable violence and being eaten alive.

name: Dero Magister
description: Dero magisters are leaders among dero society.

name: Dero Stalker
description: Dero stalkers are those charged with exploring the surface world by night and seeking out new victims to abduct.

name: Dero Strangler
description: Dero stranglers specialize in capturing living victims, and they are often called upon to aid in abductions.

name: Desert Drake
description: Distant cousins of blue dragons that lack their relatives’ magical talents and intelligence, these desert-dwelling drakes are nonetheless dangerous ambush predators, preying upon isolated desert travelers and outposts for food and supplies.

name: Desert Giant
description: Desert giants are nomadic humanoids who have dwelled in the world's most arid regions since time immemorial.

name: Destrachan
description: This underground reptilian horror walks on two powerful hind legs.

name: Devourer
description: When fiends and powerful evil spellcasters are lost beyond the farthest reaches of the multiverse, they sometimes return as horrific undead called devourers that consume the souls of the living to fuel their arcane machinations.

name: Dezullon
description: Dezullons are dangerous carnivorous pitcher plants that dwell in forested regions with thick canopies.

name: Dhampir Wizard
description: This dhampir is a svetocher, the child of a moroi vampire.

name: Dig-Widget
description: Thieves covet dig-widgets, specialized constructs built for infiltration.

name: Dire Wolf
description: Much larger and more foul-tempered than their common cousins, dire wolves haunt primeval lands that accommodate their massive size and proportionately large hunting grounds and appetites.

name: Div, Aghash
description: Walking embodiments of curses, misfortune, and the evil eye, aghashes wander the deserts of the Material Plane, searching out the arrogant, charming, and persuasive to humiliate and undermine.

name: Div, Doru
description: These deceivers whisper fetid lies, sowing dark and dread inspiration into foolish mortal ears.

name: Div, Pairaka
description: Often charming, sometimes even seductive, pairakas worm their way into mortal relationships, subtly destroying the ties of friendship and love through emotional and physical corruption and plague.

name: Div, Sepid
description: Sepids are the brutal warlords of the divs, delighting in violence against mortals and their own particular flavor of vengeance.

name: Divine Warden Of Brigh
description: Imbued with the divine energy of the goddess of clockwork and invention, divine wardens of Brigh are prominent in Alkenstar as guardians of the Temple of Brigh there.

name: Divine Warden Of Nethys
description: This divine warden serves Nethys, the neutral god of magic.

name: Djinni
description: Benevolent genies from the Plane of Air, djinn value art, culture, knowledge, and trade.

name: Doblagub (Elder Brughadatch)
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 79
description: Elder brughadatches command groups of fellow brughadatches, who placate the doblagub with fresh meals and trophies of the group’s grisly catches.

name: Domovoi
description: The elderly domovoi are patrons of the home and the dearest of all house spirits to the people they live with.

name: Doorwarden
description: Doorwardens are constructs originally invented by elves.

name: Doppelganger
description: In their natural forms, doppelgangers are humanoid creatures with flesh of indeterminate color and features that lack fine details, as if unfinished.

name: Doprillu
description: The aberrations known as doprillus are hulks with banded muscles who wear ornate masks at all times that fill their wearers with magical strength and fighting spirit.

name: Dracolisk
description: Dracolisks are rare magical crossbreeds of chromatic dragons and basilisks.

name: Draconal (Dragon Agathion)
description: Dragon agathions, known as draconals, number among the most powerful of their kin, and also the wisest, embodying the wisdom of the benevolent philosopher-king.

name: Dragon Turtle
description: When sailors warn others of the terrible threats of the open sea, they seldom forget to mention dragon turtles—immense aquatic dragons with rocky shells similar to those of tortoises and flippers powerful enough to overturn hardy vessels.

name: Dragon's Blood Puffball
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 79
description: This bulbous, deep red fungus looks like an enormous, decaying rose.

name: Dragonscarred Dead
source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 82
description: Not all would-be dragonslayers who die a valiant death rest peacefully amid the annals of legend.

name: Dragonshard Guardian
description: Created by Mengkare and powered by a shard of the Orb of Gold Dragonkind, this construct is made of sculpted crystal draped in a beautiful gold filigree frame.

name: Drainberry Bush
description: Drainberry bushes are floating bushes that originate from the First World, with long, thorny vines and dense clusters of bright-red berries.

name: Drakauthix
description: The drakauthix is a massive fungus that floats through the heights of the largest Darklands caverns, propelled by bladders that spray air and spores.

name: Dramofir
description: Beings of inscrutable intent and incredible power, dramofirs hail from the Dreamlands and shamble across the multiverse in search of dreams to incorporate into their voluminous robes.

name: Draugr
description: Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep.

name: Draxie
description: The mischievous dragon sprites known as draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries.

name: Dread Dhuthorex
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 80
description: More intelligent than their lesser kin, dread dhuthorexes possess eerie, enchanting powers.

name: Dread Wisp
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 81
description: Will-o'-wisps native to the Darklands are more ominous and malevolent than those that bob about in the lonely marshes and surfaces of the upper world.

name: Dread Wraith
description: These menacing spiritual remnants of wicked warlords or bloodthirsty generals are towering specters of shadow and death.

name: Dreadsong Dancer
description: Dreadsong dancers are shaped from the souls of bards, dancers, and musicians who pledged themselves to Hell in exchange for enhanced artistic ability.

name: Dream Spider
description: A dream spider's webs have an iridescent hue and are infused with the same hallucinogenic compound as the creature's toxin.

name: Dreshkan
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 78
description: Because morlocks are descended from distant human ancestors, clumsily or hastily fleshwarping a morlock simply produces a grothlut.

name: Dretch (Sloth Demon)
description: Among the lowest and least powerful of all demons, dretches are just as vicious and cruel as their more powerful brethren.

name: Drider
description: The first fleshwarping process mastered by the drow remains both their most successful and most infamous: the drider.

name: Drow Fighter
description: Drow fighters train to master techniques that inflict deep, bleeding wounds and use poisoned crossbow bolts to exhaust enemies.

name: Drow Hunter
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 82
description: Hunters seek out game to keep drow communities fed and functioning.

name: Drow Priestess
description: Many drow priestesses venerate demon lords and other foul divinities.

name: Drow Rogue
description: Loners at heart, drow rogues trust no one—least of all fellow slayers.

name: Drow Shootist
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 83
description: The rare few drow who specialize in the repeating hand crossbow command respect not only for their skills but for their luck and swagger.

name: Drow Warden
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 82
description: Wardens watch over drow encampments and often work in small groups.

name: Dryad Queen (Hamadryad)
description: Hamadryads rule over an entire forest, or a portion of an incredibly large forest, leading and protecting all dryads within.

name: Dryad
description: Dryads are fey guardians of the trees and creatures who dwell in wooded areas.

name: Duende
description: Duendes fancy themselves as lords of the land—which is true, in a literal sense, these spirits embody the very soil upon the ground.

name: Duergar Bombardier
description: Alchemy intrigues many duergars, and their cruel traditions often motivate them to experiment on slaves.

name: Duergar Sharpshooter
description: Duergar sharpshooters serve both as ranged support for slaver parties and as snipers posted on towers overlooking quarries and other areas where enslaved workers toil away the hours.

name: Duergar Taskmaster
description: Duergar priests of the taskmaster god Droskar often assume leadership roles within their communities, advancing the goals of their deity through coercion and displays of force.

name: Dullahan
description: Riding on a horse as black as night, the headless hunter known as the dullahan tracks down and takes the heads of those it deems unfit to continue living.

name: Duneshaker Solifugid
description: The largest solifugids, duneshakers, are so immense that their movements make the terrain around them tremble.

name: Duskwalker
description: Duskwalkers are infused with the same energies as psychopomps.

name: Dust Mephit
description: Whining and self-important creatures, dust mephits are known for their tendency to pronounce doom and gloom at every opportunity, lamenting every insignificant and minor difficulty as though it were an insurmountable obstacle and making themselves out to be heroes for struggling valiantly against their cruel fates.

name: Dvorovoi
description: Traditionally, the dvorovoi is seen as the domovoi's younger sibling and has charge of a peasant's yard and all the animals and tools within.

name: Dweomercat
description: Dweomercats are magically gifted felines from the First World, where they prey upon other creatures and feed upon their primal energy.

name: Dybbuk
description: The discorporated spirits called dybbuks arise from souls denied respite in the afterlife, often because they committed some great transgression in life.

name: D'ziriak
description: These strange creatures are native to the Plane of Shadows, where their colorful nature is in opposition to that realm's overwhelmingly monochromatic palette.

name: Eagle
description: These large birds of prey swoop down from incredible heights to snatch fish and small mammals in their powerful talons.

name: Earth Mephit
description: Earth mephits are humorless and trudge about their tasks with little enthusiasm.

name: Earth Wisp
description: Earth wisps are rolling spheres of rock, mud, and leaves, perpetually humming with low, rumbling energy.

name: Earthen Destrier
description: This wave of dirt takes the crude likeness of the melded forequarters of a charging warhorse and a rocky knight wielding a rudimentary lance of gray stone.

name: Eberark
description: The terrifying apex predators known as eberarks torment their prey, spewing oil from their mouths that they can then set alight.

name: Efreeti
description: The efreet are hateful and merciless genies from the Plane of Fire, where they build metropolises and massive trade centers that draw extraplanar travelers from across the multiverse.

name: Einherji
description: Einherjar are mighty warriors chosen by valkyries from the ranks of those slain in terrible and legendary battles.

name: Elananx
description: These strange, fey felines resemble large, broad bobcats from a distance, but a closer view reveals something amiss.

name: Elasmosaurus
description: Elasmosauruses are long-necked, primeval reptiles that dwell in deep oceans and seas.

name: Elder Sphinx
description: Towering over their kin, elder sphinxes are the pharaonic masters of their kind.

name: Elder Wyrmwraith
description: The most powerful of these monsters, elder wyrmwraiths, sometimes form spontaneously from legendary dragons haunted by an irrational fear of the afterlife, but most have simply existed for over a thousand years, growing in power all the while.

name: Electric Eel
description: Usually found in freshwater rivers and lakes, an electric eel is not particularly aggressive, but its ability to stun predators and prey alike can be dangerous to larger creatures searching for their next meals.

name: Elemental Avalanche
description: Stubborn and ponderous, elemental avalanches are massive beings of living rock and dirt.

name: Elemental Hurricane
description: Elemental hurricanes embody the ferocity of violent windstorms.

name: Elemental Inferno
description: Walking conflagrations of unimaginably hot fire, elemental infernos are harbingers of destruction and heedless chaos.

name: Elemental Tsunami
description: Elemental tsunamis are huge and destructive.

name: Elemental Vessel, Water
source: Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale pg. 82
description: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

name: Elephant
description: Those who live near elephants have learned to be wary of angering the beasts, but even with precautions in place, elephants sometimes still rampage.

name: Eloko
description: If a biloko is lucky enough to consume several spellcasters or other creatures with innate magical abilities, it undergoes a subtle transformation over the course of 1 week.

name: Elysian Titan
description: Those titans who remained true to their creators, refusing to participate in their peers' rebellion, earned their freedom while the others were imprisoned.

name: Ember Fox
description: Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow.

name: Emperor Bird
description: The emperor bird is native to the jungles of the Mwangi Expanse and known for its brilliant plumage and innate magic.

name: Emperor Cobra
description: These aggressive serpents infest bogs and lowlands.

name: Empress Bore Worm
description: When an area lacks sufficient food, the bore worms in a swarm become increasingly agitated and desperate.

name: Eremite
description: Eremites roam the planes to seek out ideal portions of other creatures, such as a hero's sword-arm or an angel's pinions.

name: Erinyes (Fury Devil)
description: Erinyes exact vengeance and bloody justice for a creature’s crimes, torturing and punishing their victims in ironic fashion before allowing them the escape of death.

name: Esipil
description: Among the least of the sahkils, esipils delight in spreading fears and uncertainty among people who live with animals that could turn on them.

name: Esobok
description: Esoboks are brute hunters and pugnacious sentinels that serve as the guard dogs of the Boneyard.

name: Ether Spider
description: Ether spiders are deadly predators from the Ethereal Plane resembling giant arachnids.

name: Etioling
description: When the primal spark of the First World nestled in a gnome's heart is engulfed in Radiant Fire, it fights back, pushing against death with riotous life and creating an etioling.

name: Ettin
description: Two heads aren’t always better than one.

name: Eunemvro
description: Eunemvros wander the Material Plane with the sole purpose of destroying undead.

name: Evangelist
description: Evangelists, the velstracs' unofficial ambassadors, roam the farthest reaches of the planes to spread the word of their kind's abhorrent belief in perfection through pain.

name: Excorion
description: These hideous undead creatures result from an exquisitely painful necromantic process where flayed humanoids are animated through their exposed blood vessels.

name: Faceless Butcher
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 80
description: The deformed flesh on this humanoid horror’s head bears grim holes where their eyes, nose, mouth, and ears should be, and little else.

name: Faceless Stalker (Ugothol)
description: Among the subtler of the alghollthu creations were the ugothols—also known as faceless stalkers.

name: Fading Fox
description: With fur that shifts between hues of red, dull brown, and silver as it moves, the fading fox vexes any pursuer.

name: Faerie Dragon
description: Although they are much smaller than their larger dragon cousins, faerie dragons have the many of the same physiological attributes, including long necks, toothy maws, sinuous tails, and sharp claws.

name: Feathered Bear
description: Born from spirits possessing the qualities of strength, endurance, and ferocity, these spirit guides act as martial guardians for mortals under their care.

name: Fen Mosquito Swarm
description: When deadly fen mosquitoes gather in large numbers, they form into lethal swarms capable of draining blood at a truly alarming rate.

name: Feral Skull Swarm
description: Some skull swarms are crafted from the heads of feral and dangerous beasts.

name: Festrog
description: Spawned from corpses of those who died of illness or starvation and twisted by negative energy, festrogs display a visciousness that rivals other undead.

name: Fetchling Scout
description: The people known today as fetchlings are a distinct ancestry descended from generations of humans who became trapped ages ago on the Shadow Plane.

name: Filth Fire
description: These creatures look like roiling clouds of black smoke churning above a mound of burning refuse.

name: Fire Giant
description: The most militaristic of all giants, fire giants focus obsessively on learning combat techniques, mastering the arts of forging weapons and armor, and finding new ways to dominate their enemies.

name: Fire Jellyfish Swarm
description: While individually one of these fist-sized jellyfish is merely a nuisance, in great numbers, fire jellyfish can form into dangerous swarms.

name: Fire Mephit
description: Fire mephits are conniving and quick to anger.

name: Fire Wisp
description: Fire wisps are sizzling spheres of flame and ash, perpetually crackling and shimmering with heat.

name: Fire Yai
description: Fire yai take the form of fire giants.

name: Firewyrm
description: Firewyrms live in tubes of molten lava found throughout the Plane of Fire.

name: Fjord Linnorm
description: Fjord linnorms make their homes in damp caves behind ice-cold waterfalls in the river-veined coastal reaches of the north.

name: Flame Drake
description: The distant kin of red dragons, flame drakes thankfully lack the intelligence and ambition of their larger cousins, but are no less territorial or violent.

name: Flaming Skull
description: More dangerous than simple severed heads, these skulls are wreathed in unearthly flames.

name: Flash Beetle
description: These 3-foot-long insects boast a pair of glowing organs on the back of the abdomen that give off bright light and that continue to glow for days, even after the creature’s death.

name: Flea Swarm
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83
description: Flea swarms roil across city streets and rural hinterlands in a hissing, scraping scrabble, draining blood from any creatures unfortunate enough to cross their path.

name: Flesh Golem
description: Made of odd scraps of skin and muscle, a flesh golem is a grotesque parody of life.

name: Flickerwisp
description: The dancing, twisting flickerwisp is a less powerful but no less malevolent type of will-o'-wisp.

name: Flumph
description: Even among the numerous types of tentacled aberrations populating the lands of Golarion, flumphs are an anomaly.

name: Flytrap Leshy
description: While often seen as unfriendly by non-leshys, flytrap leshys get along well with other leshys.

name: Forge-Spurned
source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 83
description: Evil dwarves who die having failed to live up to the exacting standards of the duergar god Droskar are sometimes forced to return to the material world as undead abominations known as forge-spurned.

name: Fortune Eater
description: The fickle finger of fate has quashed hundreds of fledgling adventurers, sometimes in a particularly memorable or ignominious manner.

name: Fossil Golem
description: Fossil golems are typically made from the fossilized bones of dinosaurs and other ancient megafauna, though some crafters stretch the definition and instead use magically petrified bones of dragons or even giants.

name: Froghemoth
description: A terrifying abomination of teeth, tentacles, and unbridled rage, the froghemoth is thankfully rarely encountered even in the deepest swamplands or most remote Darklands caverns.

name: Frost Drake
description: Frost drakes pose an immense danger in the frozen reaches they call home, where they roam far and wide to hunt for prey such as caribou, wolves, small bears, and tundra-dwelling people.

name: Frost Giant
description: Frost giants are remorseless marauders who pillage and plunder from those who dare to live near them in desolate, frigid lands.

name: Frost Troll
description: Frost trolls are nightmarish frozen monsters of rime-stained claws and hoarfrost teeth.

name: Frost Worm
description: The frost worm's single round, red eye gleams prominently at the head of its monstrous mass, white as a winter snowfall.

name: Frost Yai
description: Ice yai combine the brutality of frost giants with the grace of martial artists.

name: Fuath
description: Despite their small size, fuaths are shipwreckers incarnate.

name: Fuming Sludge
description: The slurry from alchemical experiments is often as flammable as it is toxic.

name: Fungus Leshy
description: Fungus leshys guard caves, bogs, and damp, dark places.

name: Gahlepod (Juvenile Brughadatch)
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 78
description: The youngest brughadatches resemble overlarge tadpoles about 2 feet long.

name: Galvo
description: A galvo is a bizarre humanoid creature made up of electric eels—dozens of them, transmogrified into one cooperative, electrified body.

name: Gancanagh (Passion Azata)
description: Gancanaghs are lovers, revelers, and dashing duelists of Elysium.

name: Ganzi
description: Children of primeval chaos, ganzis intertwine the churning pandemonium of the Maelstrom with the more mundane tumult of mortal life.

name: Gargoyle
description: Gargoyles are monstrous hunters made of elemental stone.

name: Garuda
description: Garudas are noble, birdlike beings descended from the gods.

name: Gashadokuro
source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 84
description: The dreaded gashadokuro is an undead haunter of the night, a giant skeleton that rises from the earth in the aftermath of a mass starvation event and seeks to inflict its unending hunger on the living.

name: Gathlain Wanderer
description: Gathlains have made a name for themselves as inquisitive and mischievous, as well as flighty and distractable.

name: Gelatinous Cube
description: Found underground or in dungeons, these quivering cubes of slime continuously scour their domain for food.

name: Gelugon (Ice Devil)
description: Insectile ice devils are strategists and masterminds in Hell’s armies, using their superior intellect to strike against their enemies and spread Hell’s influence throughout the planes.

name: Ghaele (Crusader Azata)
description: Ghaeles are fiend-hunting knights of Elysium and champions of the freedom to take up arms against oppressors and other evils.

name: Ghast
description: Ghasts—feral, foul-smelling, and constantly hungry—are the more powerful kin of ghouls.

name: Ghonhatine
description: In transforming xulgaths, drow fleshwarpers sought not to create a new type of creature but to recapture a form of xulgath predecessor believed entirely vanished from Golarion.

name: Ghoran Manipulator
description: This ghoran manipulator relies on charm to survive.

name: Ghost Commoner
description: The ghost commoner is an ordinary person who believes they died unjustly, usually due to foul play or betrayal.

name: Ghost Mage
description: A wizard who died with a major project left undone might become a ghost mage, constantly seeking to finish its task in undeath.

name: Ghoul
description: Ghouls are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

name: Giant Amoeba
description: These blobs of nearly transparent protoplasm are identical in form and behavior to the microscopic creatures from which they have evolved, except their outlandish size makes them all the more dangerous.

name: Giant Anaconda
description: The monstrous giant anaconda is capable of swallowing whole creatures as big as horses—to say nothing of their riders.

name: Giant Animated Statue
description: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations.

name: Giant Ant
description: Giant ants are much like their smaller kin in their industrious habits, though growing to the size of ponies makes them much deadlier.

name: Giant Aukashungi
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 77
description: The strongest individual in an aukashungi swarm eventually grows to monstrous proportions.

name: Giant Badger
description: The violent, territorial giant badger is a relentless predator.

name: Giant Bat
description: While big bats are certainly not uncommon in dark caves and abandoned ruins and may instill fear in squeamish spelunkers, the so-called giant bat is a true monster, weighing well over 100 pounds and having a wingspan of nearly 15 feet.

name: Giant Bone Skipper
description: While less common than the smaller variety, giant bone skippers are the stuff of nightmares for morticians and graveyard keepers.

name: Giant Centipede
description: Most giant centipedes (known as sewer centipedes when found in cities) nest in small groups but hunt alone when they seek out food.

name: Giant Chameleon
description: Giant chameleons are legendary for their ability to change their skin color in response to their surroundings.

name: Giant Cockroach
description: Cockroaches are communal creatures, rarely setting out on their own unless they are searching for food.

name: Giant Crab
description: Crabs are scavenging crustaceans known for their hard shells and iconic sideways gait.

name: Giant Crawling Hand
description: A giant crawling hand is the appendage of a very large creature, such as a giant.

name: Giant Dragonfly Nymph
description: The aquatic, wingless offspring of dragonflies are called dragonfly nymphs.

name: Giant Dragonfly
description: These buzzing insects are the size of a small horse.

name: Giant Eagle
description: No mere animals, giant eagles have a keen intellect and a strong sense of honor.

name: Giant Flea
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 83
description: Giant fleas are commonly found in areas containing hardy megafauna, such as dinosaurs or mammoths.

name: Giant Fly
description: This pony-sized fly's twitching limbs seem to never stop moving as it constantly cleans itself and scoops anything edible into its mouthparts.

name: Giant Flying Squirrel
description: Though other squirrels can fall from a great height safely, flying squirrels can soar through the air.

name: Giant Flytrap
description: Because they blend in so well with surrounding foliage, giant flytraps can use the element of surprise to make quick strikes against unsuspecting adventurers and forest travelers.

name: Giant Frilled Lizard
description: Found in warm and tropical forests and savannas, these immense lizards are a deadly threat to the unsuspecting traveler.

name: Giant Frog
description: Giant frogs can grow up to 6 feet long and weigh over 200 pounds, with rows of razor-sharp teeth lining their gaping mouths.

name: Giant Gecko
description: These roughly human-sized reptiles have amazing feet capable of clinging tenaciously to any surface.

name: Giant Hermit Crab
description: Lucky hermit crabs with plentiful resources can live for decades and grow to tremendous sizes, often with magical help.

name: Giant Hippocampus
description: Living in the deepest reaches of the ocean, giant hippocampi haven't been sighted near the shore and are often regarded as legends made up by sailors.

name: Giant Jellyfish
description: Unlike its smaller cousins, the giant jellyfish is an active predator that chases down its prey through reefs or open water.

name: Giant Leech
description: Capable of growing to lengths of nearly 5 feet, giant leeches have circular maws filled with hook-like teeth.

name: Giant Maggot
description: Giant flies lay their eggs on the bodies of larger monsters or livestock.

name: Giant Mantis
description: These massive cousins of normal praying mantises stand taller than an average human.

name: Giant Monitor Lizard
description: Large and seemingly ponderous, a monitor lizard is a deceptively swift and ruthless predator.

name: Giant Moray Eel
description: Giant moray eels dwell in warm, tropical waters and build lairs in narrow, twisting caves made of coral.

name: Giant Mosquito
description: These horrifically enlarged versions of the common mosquito often prey upon megafauna like dinosaurs and other large creatures, but they won't turn down a chance to drink the blood of a smaller target—such as a humanoid.

name: Giant Octopus
description: Giant octopuses are found in the heart of deep, dark oceans.

name: Giant Opossum
description: Larger species of opossum can eat nearly anything human-sized or smaller.

name: Giant Rat
description: Giant rats are enormous versions of the common vermin.

name: Giant Scorpion
description: These massive, terrifying arachnids are typically 8 feet long from head to the base of the tail.

name: Giant Skunk
description: Giant skunks thrive in places where their larger size and more potent musk allow them to fend off predators their smaller cousins can't.

name: Giant Slug
description: These massive, primeval relatives of ordinary slugs squirm slowly through swamps and grasslands.

name: Giant Snapping Turtle
description: If the regular-sized snapping turtle is foul-tempered, then the giant snapping turtle seems to be willfully violent toward anything that dares intrude upon its domain.

name: Giant Solifugid
description: The smallest of giant solifugids are still large enough to harry desert traders and their mounts.

name: Giant Squid
description: Dwelling deep within the oceans, this huge cephalopod grows up to 45 feet in length and can weigh up to 600 pounds.

name: Giant Stag Beetle
description: The giant stag beetle is larger than a horse, and the sight of one flying (if slowly and somewhat clumsily) on great buzzing wings is unnerving.

name: Giant Tarantula
description: Tarantulas are ambush predators, but will attack prey in the open.

name: Giant Tick
description: This grotesque tick is the size of a dog and scurries with surprising speed.

name: Giant Toad
description: Most giant toads live in dry environments, particularly deserts, and eagerly eat almost any creature smaller than themselves.

name: Giant Viper
description: The giant viper’s fangs are a frightening sight, with injection tubes as long as daggers.

name: Giant Wasp
description: Giant wasps are much more dangerous but less common than their smaller kin, and—to the relief of those who encounter them—they tend to be solitary.

name: Giant Whiptail Centipede
description: Whiptail centipedes are sleek and swift tunnel predators.

name: Giant Wolverine
