description: Giant wolverines grow to the approximate size of horses and claim even more expansive territories than their more diminutive wolverine cousins.

name: Gibbering Mouther
description: Amorphous blobs of yammering mouths and oozing, fleshy sludge, gibbering mouthers are among the strangest creatures found either aboveground or below.

name: Gibtanius
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 81
description: When a gibtas feeds regularly but never receives sufficient food to procreate, it grows into a mighty gibtanius.

name: Gibtas Bounder
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 80
description: A full-grown gibtas uses its powerful legs and rubbery body to bound great distances.

name: Gibtas Spawn Swarm
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 80
description: When a gibtas gorges itself on an incredible amount of flesh, it vomits up a pool of acid filled with tiny pink egg sacs that burst immediately.

name: Gimmerling
description: Gimmerlings are small, shapeshifting fey who stage ambushes to sate their endless hunger and childish greed.

name: Girtablilu Seer
description: The highest position of authority in a girtablilu community is the group's religious leader.

name: Girtablilu Sentry
description: Sentries patrol the outskirts of a girtablilu communities, watching for external threats like desert drakes, blue dragons, or adventuring parties set on reckless exploration of the girtablilus' sacred site.

name: Glabrezu (Treachery Demon)
description: Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe.

name: Glass Golem
description: Crafted of hardened glass and held together by magically treated lead, glass golems are both deadly guardians and works of exquisite art.

name: Gliminal
description: Beholding the blinding light of a gliminal is akin to staring into the sun, and consequently, only gliminals themselves fully understand what they are or how they truly look.

name: Globster
description: The tide washes ashore all manner of detritus, from harmless seaweed and shells to the rotting corpses of massive aquatic creatures.

name: Gnoll Cultist
description: Gnoll cultists serve as their clans’ spiritual guides and conduits to the divine.

name: Gnoll Hunter
description: Gnoll hunters serve their clans by hunting for food in the wilds, marauding along well-traveled roads, and tracking down escaped slaves.

name: Gnoll Sergeant
description: When gnolls band together to form hunting or raiding parties, the strongest among them is often designated the leader or sergeant.

name: Goblin Commando
description: The theoretical leaders of goblin raids are called goblin commandos.

name: Goblin Dog
description: Goblins’ eponymous pets aren’t true canines at all, but rather large, blunt-nosed rodents with thin bodies and long legs.

name: Goblin Pyro
description: Some goblins take their people’s admiration of fire fully into the realm of deadly obsession.

name: Goblin War Chanter
description: While all goblins enjoy singing, goblin war chanters pride themselves on mastering the art of vocal performance.

name: Goblin Warrior
description: The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups—especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

name: Gogiteth
description: A gogiteth is a slavering nightmare of teeth, eyes, and hairy spiderlike legs, and its appearance is invariably seared into the minds of any who witness it.

name: Goliath Spider
description: Goliath spiders dwell in the deepest jungles, where they build webs as big as temples and feast on prey as large as hippopotami.

name: Gorgon
description: Though they may resemble constructs to the untrained eye due to their metallic, interlocking armor plates that look and feel like polished stone, gorgons are a creature of flesh and bone.

name: Gorilla
description: Gorillas can be territorial creatures, particularly if provoked by hunters or the presence of more dangerous monsters.

name: Gosreg
description: Gosregs are agents of the Dominion of the Black that insinuate themselves into humanoid societies to foster the goals of their sinister alien masters.

name: Gourd Leshy
description: Gourd leshys are guardians of fields, gardens, and farms.

name: Granite Glyptodont
description: This squat and stony creature looks like an armadillo with a large raised back and a flail-like tail.

name: Grauladon
description: Grauladons are vicious predators that appear crocodilian in form, but are in fact distant offshoots of dragonkind.

name: Graveknight
description: Graveknights are undead warriors granted unlife by a cursed suit of armor.

name: Graveshell
description: The graveshell is a dangerous predator that draws scavengers and explorers into its grasp using a morbid lure: the corpse of a former victim impaled upon the spikes that protrude from its large, turtle-like shell.

name: Gray Ooze
description: These dangerous oozes are the bane of any who travel through swamps, marshes, or damp caves.

name: Great Cyclops
description: Gigantic, dim-witted loners, the great cyclopes embody their lesser kin writ large.

name: Great White Shark
description: An apex predator among the coastal surface waters where it hunts, the great white shark is one of the largest shark species.

name: Greater Barghest
description: Once a barghest has eaten enough to grow into a greater barghest, it typically seeks a method to leave the Material Plane and return to the Abyss, there joining other fiends as yet another of that plane’s horrors.

name: Greater Nightmare
description: The enormous greater nightmare is a more dangerous variety of nightmare, particularly valued for its ability to invade other realities with its rider.

name: Greater Shadow
description: Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Shadow Plane and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

name: Green Hag
description: Green hags hate beauty and purity, so they use disguises and treachery to lure and murder innocents, corrupt the pure of heart, and shatter the minds and morals of their victims.

name: Green Man
description: Green men are ancient, enigmatic lesser deities of the primeval forests, living embodiments of nature and plantkind.

name: Grendel
description: This reaver of the cold marsh is not just a monster; he is a force of nature.

name: Griffon
description: Griffons are regal beasts revered as symbols of freedom and strength in many cultures.

name: Grig
description: Grigs are kindly musicians of the fey, often getting themselves into trouble due to their penchant for confronting evil well beyond their ability to vanquish.

name: Grikkitog
description: Grikkitogs, also known as “hungry earth,” are strange parasites from the Plane of Earth that infest and possess earth, rock, and stone in order to feed their endless hunger.

name: Grim Reaper
description: The Grim Reaper is the unflinching personification of death.

name: Grimple
description: Even more than most gremlins, grimples resent the trappings of civilization: inn common rooms with their rowdy singalongs, livery yards with their whinnying horses, church steeples with their clanging bells.

name: Grimstalker
description: These violently murderous fey have one purpose: to stealthily hunt down and slay humanoids brazen enough to dare set foot in the wilderness.

name: Grindylow
description: The top half of a grindylow looks vaguely like that of a goblin, but from the waist down, their bodies split into a tangle of suckered, wriggling tentacles.

name: Grioth Cultist
description: Grioth cultists represent the lowest tier of their remorseless cult—worshippers of the Elder Mythos tasked with leading scouting missions into new worlds.

name: Grioth Scout
description: The first grioths encountered on a new world are scouts.

name: Grippli Archer
description: These sharpshooters are renowned for their patience and their accuracy.

name: Grippli Greenspeaker
description: The unofficial healers of gripplikind are known as greenspeakers.

name: Grippli Scout
description: Gripplis make their homes in the treetops of tropical jungles and forests.

name: Grizzly Bear
description: This large and powerful omnivore inhabits forested hills.

name: Grodair
description: Grodairs are bizarre fishlike creature native to the First World.

name: Grothlut
description: Sluglike abominations, grothluts are fleshwarps that were once humans.

name: Guard Dog
description: The typical guard dog is loyal to and beloved by many communities.

name: Guardian Naga
description: The opposite of dark nagas in many ways, guardian nagas are benevolent and wise protectors of places of great natural or supernatural significance: ancient oak groves, forgotten holy temples, and vaults of sacred power are just a few examples of locations that these nagas protect.

name: Guecubu
description: Sometimes an individual performs acts of horror so unspeakable that the earth they walk on becomes imprinted by their evil.

name: Gug
description: A gug’s most horrid feature is its barrel-shaped head, which splits vertically to reveal numerous rows of sharp, yellow teeth and an open throat.

name: Gurgist
description: Humans that become mortics are known as gurgists.

name: Guthallath
description: A guthallath is an enormous construct created long ago by some unknown empire, probably as a war machine.

name: Gylou (Handmaiden Devil)
description: Though gylous are deeply entrenched in the expansive and complex machinations of Hell, they are highly skilled agents capable of nuanced diplomacy, masterful deception, physical finesse, and nearly any other tasks they set their minds to.

name: Hadrinnex
description: The bizarre hadrinnexes resemble defensive systems more than living creatures.

name: Hadrosaurid
description: Hadrosaurids are a broad grouping of herbivorous dinosaurs that share characteristic flat snouts filled with rows of grinding teeth well suited for feeding on vegetation.

name: Hamatula (Barbed Devil)
description: Hamatulas are forged in Erebus to protect infernal vaults from those foolish enough to try to rob the archdevil Mammon.

name: Haniver
description: Hanivers are the most benign type of gremlin—capricious fey who skim the waves on rubbery fin-wings.

name: Harmona
description: Catching a glimpse of a harmona is said to be lucky.

name: Harpy
description: Harpies are filthy amalgamations of human and bird, resembling feral humans with wings, talons, and mouths full of sharp teeth.

name: Harpy Skeleton
description: A live harpy's song is compelling and captivating; a harpy skeleton's is anything but, rending the target's mind.

name: Harrow Doll
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 81
description: Harrow dolls are unique constructs that can make predictions about the future.

name: Hatred Siktempora
description: Spawned by acts and legacies of cold-blooded spite, hatred siktemporas kill indiscriminately out of pure loathing, methodically hunting down and slaughtering anyone who catches their vile attention.

name: Hegessik
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 80
description: Anchorites of the proteans, hegessiks live solitary lives roaming the dangerous wilds of the Maelstrom.

name: Hekatonkheires Titan
description: The first three hekatonkheires were meant to guard the gates to the Abyss, but they proved too terrifying and rebellious— and so, in disgust, the gods cast them into the gulfs between the planes.

name: Hell Hound
description: A hell hound’s appearance dismisses any doubts as to its infernal origins—flesh the color of burning pitch, teeth as sharp as any fiend's pitchfork, and a shroud of ever-burning hell are are all trademark features.

name: Hellbound Attorney
description: The Hellbound attorney sought the assistance of a phistophilus—one of Hell's contract devils—to bolster her legalistic ability on the Material Plane.

name: Hellcat
description: Hellcats are devious predators native to the fiery pits of Hell.

name: Hellcrown
description: The life of a Hellknight is bloody, brutal, and often short.

name: Hellwasp Swarm
description: Hellwasps' infernal nature allows them to collectively inhabit and control humanoid corpses, and they use this ability to infest and horrify large swathes of territory unless destroyed.

name: Herecite of Zevgavizeb
description: Secreted away in the dark corners of unnamed libraries, necromancer’s dens, and heretical scriptoriums, obscure texts describe a horrifying ritual that combines sacrifice and suffering to create a powerful undead being known as a herecite.

name: Herexen
description: When a cleric rebels against their deity and dies in the grip of blasphemous rage, the heresies they committed in life may fuel their transformation into an undead herexen.

name: Hermit Crab Swarm
description: When hermit crabs find a shell that is too large, they lie in wait for others to arrive and move into the shell, abandoning a possible replacement.

name: Hesperid Queen
description: Hesperid queens rule over isolated regions soaked in the light of sunset.

name: Hesperid
description: Hesperides are nymphs of sunset, guardians of the colorful golden hues of the setting sun.

name: Hezrou (Toad Demon)
description: Hezrous dwell in the vast and endless Abyssal swamps, mires, and waterways and are equally at home on land and in the water.

name: Hieracosphinx
description: Lacking the intelligence of their kin, falcon-headed hieracosphinxes are cowardly, cruel-hearted creatures.

name: Hill Giant
description: Selfish and crude, these rough-skinned raiders are bullies and ultimately cowards.

name: Hippocampus
description: Hippocampi serve as steeds for aquatic humanoids or roam wild in the sea.

name: Hippogriff
description: With the proud bearing of a great raptor and the magnificence of a powerful horse, hippogriffs are thought to be an accidental fusion of creatures or perhaps the creation of a flesh-warping wizard with a keen aesthetic sense.

name: Hippopotamus
description: Typical adult hippos move quickly on land and attack stealthily in the water.

name: Hive Mother
description: Ankhrav hive mothers are fearsome predators that one can easily distinguish from the typical ankhrav not only by their greater size, but the presence of a large pair of razor-sharp, mantis-like arms.

name: Hobgoblin Archer
description: Bands of hobgoblin soldiers typically have at least one archer among their ranks.

name: Hobgoblin General
description: Hobgoblin generals serve as leaders of entire armies and rulers of hobgoblin settlements.

name: Hobgoblin Soldier
description: Soldiers make up the bulk of hobgoblin society, whether that society is a village or a military unit.

name: Hodag
description: Because they are often described only in drunken retellings of loggers' or miners' tales, hodags are considered by many to exist only in the local folklore of remote areas.

name: Homunculus
description: A homunculus is a tiny servitor construct created by a crafter to serve as a spy, scout, messenger, or assistant.

name: Horned Archon
description: Horned archons are secretive and tireless sentinels and scouts, patrolling the Outer Sphere’s untamed wilds for evil to eliminate and keeping small communities safe from demons, devils, and worse.

name: Hound Archon
description: Among the rank-and-file soldiers of Heaven's armies, few individuals are more dependable and truer to the cause than the noble hound archons, embodiments of the virtue of diligence.

name: Hound Of Tindalos
description: Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time.

name: House Drake
description: Beautifully colored in purples and electric blues, these tiny dragons are genuinely brilliant in more ways than one.

name: Huldra
description: At first glance, a huldra seems a simple creature—a human in plain robes or peasant dress, sporting long, unbound hair.

name: Hunting Spider
description: Hunting spiders are the most common type of giant spider, though not the largest.

name: Hyaenodon
description: Hyaenodons are the ferocious primeval cousins of the smaller hyena.

name: Hyakume
description: Hundreds of bloodshot eyes peek out from under the fleshy layers of a hyakume's skin.

name: Hydra
description: Hydras are multiheaded, foul-tempered serpentine beasts with voracious appetites, widely feared for their regeneration abilities.

name: Hyena
description: Hyenas are cunning, powerfully built carnivores that bear a heavy resemblance to dogs and other canines, though they are not themselves canines.

name: Ice Golem
description: Ice golems are either carved from massive blocks of ice, or pieced together from individual components that are then fused together through heat and refreezing.

name: Ice Linnorm
description: The ice linnorm dwells amid glacial crevasses, atop wind-blasted mountain peaks, or within glittering caverns carved from the hearts of the mightiest of icebergs.

name: Ice Mephit
description: Though capable of the same depths of cruelty as their fire mephit kin, ice mephits carry theirs out in a more calculating way.

name: Icewyrm
description: Resembling wingless, serpentine dragons formed of jagged ice and shot through with veins of nearly frozen water, these elementals dwell within icebergs and enjoy striking out at passing ships or creatures.

name: Icicle Snake
description: Translucent and capable of hanging suspended and near motionless, icicle snakes sense the heat of living creatures as a threat and attempt to use their camouflage and chilling bite against foes.

name: Iffdahsil
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 81
description: The slithering horror known as Iffdahsil is an undead shoggoth that has haunted the vault of the Black Desert for millennia.

name: Ifrit
description: Ifrits' blood blazes with elemental fire.

name: Iguanodon
description: Iguanodons are large, herbivorous dinosaurs that inhabit swamps and forests where they browse on the abundant vegetation.

name: Imentesh
description: The loquacious proteans known as imenteshes serve as missionaries, spies, and heralds of chaos to further the protean goal of reality's dissolution.

name: Immortal Ichor
source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 88
description: An immortal ichor is an intelligent mass of blood from a dead evil deity.

name: Imp
description: Imps are infiltrators and corruptors who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time.

name: Incutilis
description: Incutilises are intelligent, nautilus-like sea creatures that attack their victims' brains to take over their bodies, creating puppets to use for labor, combat, or their own malevolent amusement.

name: Intellect Devourer
description: Intellect devourers serve as advance scouts and infiltrators for the powerful force of alien beings called the Dominion of the Black.

name: Interlocutor
description: Interlocutors are the most talented surgeon-sculptors of the velstracs, carving away flesh and replacing it with new body parts of muscle, sinew, and metal.

name: Invidiak (Shadow Demon)
description: For most demons, possessing a creature requires a ritual, magic item, or condition, but for invidiaks, who lack a body, possession is akin to donning a suit of clothing.

name: Invisible Stalker
description: Invisible stalkers have a poor opinion of mortals due to the unsavory nature of the violent tasks summoners usually call them to the Material Plane to perform.

name: Ioton
description: Periodically, stray thoughts colliding on the Astral Plane become entangled, forming a knot of rudimentary intellect.

name: Iridescent Animal
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 80
description: An iridescent animal is a wild or domesticated animal that has undergone a magical transformation to become a luminescent beast that can glow in the dark and use dazzling light-based powers.

name: Irlgaunt
description: Irlgaunts resemble titanic spiders or crabs, but with cephalopod-like tendrils erupting from the tips of their chitin-armored legs.

name: Irnakurse
description: Irnakurse are surface elves who drow have subjected to particularly cruel and humiliating fleshwarping practices, as drow take special delight in the torment of their surface-dwelling kin.

name: Iron Golem
description: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill.

name: Isqulug
description: The isqulug's appearance, though unsettling, might be its least awful aspect.

name: Ittan-Momen
description: Born from large pieces of cloth, ittan-momen flutter in the air, catching the last rays of the setting sun.

name: Izfiitar
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 81
description: Occupying the pinnacle of the loose protean caste system, izfiitars enact the ever-shifting plans of the vaunted protean lords and those of the divine Speakers of the Depths.

name: Jabberwock
description: Few beasts have inspired as many legends, poems, songs, and myths in as many cultures, as this bizarre draconic creature.

name: Janni
description: Jann are genies composed of all four elements, meaning they are not quite home on any of the Elemental Planes.

name: Japalisura
description: Japalisuras have a perverse propensity for extracting embarrassing truths from the universe, using a combination of artifice and prophecy to obscure the truth and corrupt traditional soothsaying.

name: Jinkin
description: Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects.

name: Jorogumo
description: Appearing as beautiful, well-dressed humans, jorogumo lurk in the high mountains and prey on travelers.

name: Jotund Troll
description: Jotund trolls are gigantic, nine-headed horrors who prowl frigid moors, marshes, and wastelands, always alone and always enraged.

name: Jungle Drake
description: Believed to be related to green dragons, jungle drakes are dangerous hunters equipped with a debilitating venom delivered by a large barbed stinger or their noxious phlegm.

name: Jyoti
description: Jyotis are sometimes called “false phoenixes” (a term they find insulting) by the ignorant or willful.

name: Kalavakus (Slaver Demon)
description: Kalavakuses work as slavers in the Abyss, earning them the alternate moniker of “slaver demons”; these fiends round up captured victims and sell them to other fiends or unscrupulous mortals.

name: Kami, Kodama
description: A kodama is a type of kami who inhabits a tree.

name: Kami, Shikigami
description: Shikigami are the least powerful of all kami and the most common.

name: Kami, Toshigami
description: Toshigami are especially powerful kami who protect cherry trees, particularly ones in places where the primeval powers of nature remain strong.

name: Kami, Zuishin
description: Zuishin are kami warriors and archers who task themselves with watching over important shrines, ancient gates, or sacred doorways.

name: Kangaroo
description: Kangaroos are marsupials distinguished by long faces, large ears, powerful back legs and tails, and a distinctive hopping gait.

name: Kappa
description: Mischievous by nature, kappas delight in playing pranks on unsuspecting travelers.

name: Kasa-Obake
description: The jerky stomping outside in the middle of the night belongs to the kasa-obake.

name: Keketar
description: The ruling caste of the proteans, keketars orchestrate attacks against the bastions of law and adjudicate protean disputes confidently and capriciously.

name: Kelpie
description: Kelpies are malevolent amphibious fey shapechangers intent on luring mortals to their doom.

name: Khravgodon
description: Few creatures can shrug off an ankhrav's acid and crunch its chitin like a khravgodon.

name: Kimenhul
description: Among the strongest of their kind aside from the sahkil tormentors, kimenhuls work their craft to foment despair in those who fear failure, forming cycles of self-loathing.

name: Kirin
description: The rare and majestic antlered beast known as a kirin supposedly appear only in times of peace and prosperity or during the birth or death of a great sage.

name: Kishi
description: Kishis are duplicitous and murderous fey who dwell on the edges of Golarion's densest jungles.

name: Kitsune Trickster
description: Kitsune are shapeshifting, fox-like humanoids who have been blessed by the spirits.

name: Kobold Dragon Mage
description: Kobold dragon mages use magic to carry out their secret schemes.

name: Kobold Scout
description: Most kobolds encountered outside of a well-defended warren or lair are kobold scouts, creatures trained for stalking and the hunt.

name: Kobold Tunnelrunner
description: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons.

name: Kobold Warrior
description: The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches.

name: Kokogiak
description: As deadly on land as in the water, kokogiaks are one of the most feared predators of the tundra.

name: Kolyarut
description: Kolyarut inevitables are enforcers of bargains and punishers of those who fail to uphold them.

name: Kongamato
description: Though they resemble pterosaurs and hail from a similar era, kongamatos are actually a primeval branch of dragonkind.

name: Korred
description: Korreds are reclusive fey in the form of small, hirsute individuals with long, animated manes of hair.

name: Kovintus Geomancer
description: Kovintus are reclusive humanoids with an inborn talent for geomancy that ties them intrinsically to nature.

name: Kraken
description: A kraken is an enormous, squid-like leviathan with a cruel intelligence.

name: Krampus
description: Krampus is a tall, goatlike humanoid with a pointed nose, swept-back horns, and hooved feet.

name: Krooth
description: Krooths, sometimes called crocodile eaters, are fast and vicious hunters of bogs and wetlands.

name: Kuchisake-Onna
description: A kuchisake-onna, or slit-mouthed woman, is a tall, masked figure who moves with an eerie grace.

name: Kurnugian Jackal
description: Under specific planar conjunctions, Lamashtu bestows an unholy gift upon a jackal on the Material Plane.

name: Kurobozu
description: A monk who violated their monastic vows in life might arise after death to become an undead horror known as a kurobozu.

name: Kushtaka
description: Kushtaka, or “land otters” as they are sometimes known, are devious shapeshifters.

name: Lamia Matriarch
description: The brilliant and powerful lamia matriarchs possess boundless ambition, always seeking to bring more people and territory into the clutches of their kind.

name: Lamia
description: Just as they were cursed long ago, lamias can curse those they touch, clouding the mind and regressing conscious thought to purely animalistic instincts.

name: Lampad Queen
description: Lampad queens are capricious monarchs and protectors of vast underground domains, regarded in ballads and tales as allies and foes, monsters and muses.

name: Lampad
description: Lampads protect dark, hidden places underground.

name: Lantern Archon
description: Friendly, curious, and eternally optimistic, lantern archons embody the virtue of hope.

name: Leaf Leshy
description: Leaf leshys are diminutive protectors of forests clad in pine cone armor and hats of fruit, flowers, or leaves.

name: Ledalusca
description: Ledaluscas are reflective water elementals that can bring forth images previously reflected on their surfaces and wholly freeze themselves in the shapes of what they reflected.

name: Legion Archon
description: Despite their flaming blades and heavy armor, legion archons are the diplomats of peace among the archons, preferring justice via compromise and mutual benefit rather than justice by the sword.

name: Lemure
description: These shapeless masses of quivering flesh are the least of devilkind.

name: Leng Ghoul
description: In the icy nightmare dimension of Leng, ghouls with hoofed feet gather in morbid groups to worship and research, forming societies that mockingly mimic (and in their opinion, surpass) those of the living.

name: Leng Spider
description: The monstrous, bloated spiders from the windswept realm of Leng build eerie, dangerous lairs with the aid of magically compelled slaves.

name: Leopard
description: Leopards are among the smallest of the big cats, yet they are still dangerous creatures to tangle with.

name: Leprechaun
description: Leprechauns are mostly jovial tricksters who prefer mischief over conflict.

name: Lerritan
description: Lerritans are unstoppable giants with skin of volcanic glass and blood of roiling lava.

name: Lesser Death
description: No one is quite sure what lesser deaths are, though some claim that they are avatars of the grim reaper.

name: Leucrotta
description: The vile and vicious offspring of a demon lord and a monstrous species of hyenas, leucrottas are intelligent and cruel beasts.

name: Leukodaemon (Pestilence Daemon)
description: These skull-headed, vulture-winged daemons are harbingers of pestilence and servants of their patron Horseman, Apollyon.

name: Levaloch (Warmonger Devil)
description: Fearsome giants of jagged iron, levalochs serve in the armies of Hell as potent warriors and tenacious hunters—creatures of absolute discipline endlessly obedient to diabolical tyrants.

name: Leydroth
description: In ancient times, a cabal of primalists imbued an amalgam of beasts with both supernatural might and a hatred of magic itself, hoping to achieve a potent weapon for use against arcane spellcasters.

name: Lich
description: A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

name: Lifeleecher
description: Lifeleechers are mortic orcs with gray flesh, sharp claws, and protruding tusks.

name: Lillend (Muse Azata)
description: Lillends are tale-tellers, chroniclers, and champions of freedom of expression.

name: Lion Visitant
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 83
description: Scars and other marks of obvious mistreatment are the clearest indicators that an undead animal is no mere zombie.

name: Lion
description: Lions are cooperative hunters, ambushing dangerous prey in groups of lionesses that work in tandem to trap and kill their prey.

name: Living Boulder
description: Living boulders roll and glide through the Plane of Earth, gathering gemstones and metal shards until their surfaces resemble a ship's hull covered in barnacles.

name: Living Graffiti
description: A living graffiti is a painting or drawing that has come to life by magic.

name: Living Landslide
description: Living landslides resemble humanoids made of earth and gravel.

name: Living Rune
description: The most famous living runes are those of the ancient Runelords of Thassilon, resurging as Thassilon rebuilds in the modern era.

name: Living Sap
description: The tall sharinga trees of the Mwangi Expanse leak golden sap from their swollen, bulbous trunks, which coagulates when exposed to air.

name: Living Thunderclap
description: A living thunderclap is a humanoid-shaped storm cloud that cracks and booms with thunder.

name: Living Waterfall
description: Living waterfalls are humanoid-shaped columns of churning water.

name: Living Whirlwind
description: A living whirlwind resembles a roughly humanoid-shaped dust devil.

name: Living Wildfire
description: Living wildfires appear as humanoids made of living fire.

name: Lizardfolk Defender
description: The lizardfolk defender serves as a protector of the young, guardian of the settlement, and when no other options are available, soldier in time of war.

name: Lizardfolk Scout
description: Iruxi scouts are the lizardfolk most often encountered by adventurers, for these explorers and hunters spend most of their lives on the move, constantly patrolling the territories held by their enclave.

name: Lizardfolk Stargazer
description: The tradition of astrology and looking to the stars for both navigation and prognostication is well-established in iruxi society, and their wise and observant stargazers are among the people’s most respected members.

name: Locathah Hunter
description: Deep in the sea, schools of locathah—piscine humanoids armed with spears and specialized crossbows—stalk sharks, sea serpents, and giant squid from the backs of their giant moray eel mounts.

name: Love Siktempora
description: Acts of great and intense love spawn love siktemporas, kindly creatures bearing intense strength that start and end wars in the name of the love that birthed them.

name: Lovelorn
description: A particularly macabre form of undead, these spiderlike creatures resemble still-beating hearts with rib bones for legs and tendrils of gore dangling beneath.

name: Luminous Ooze
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 85
description: Luminous oozes are strange globular creatures that glow with brilliant multicolored light.

name: Lunar Naga
description: Lunar nagas are skilled diviners and astrologers whose dark scales and white hair sparkle with motes of light that mimic the night skies to which they are forever drawn.

name: Lurker In Light
description: These malicious and strange fey appear as fairies about 2 feet tall, with insectile wings, large eyes, and bulbous heads.

name: Lusca
source: Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale pg. 83
description: A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus.

name: Lyrakien (Wanderer Azata)
description: Lyrakiens are musical messengers and embodiments of free travel.

name: Maftet Guardian
description: Maftets are hawk-winged humanoids with leonine lower bodies that dwell in ancient ruins and cities thought lost, typically in desert or mountain regions.

name: Magma Scorpion
description: Whether skittering through Abyssal wastelands or basking in the searing sand of the deepest deserts, magma scorpions have charred carapaces constantly emitting vision-warping waves of heat.

name: Maharaja
description: The most powerful of all rakshasas, maharajas form very rarely, never more than once or twice a century, and only from the reincarnated spirits of other powerful and wicked rakshasas.

name: Mammoth
description: Found mostly in colder climates, mammoths are accustomed to dealing with desperate and dangerous predators, trampling and crushing their enemies while using their larger tusks to greater effect.

name: Mandragora
description: A mandragora looks like a freshly pulled tuber that has grown into the malformed shape of a child with a grotesque face and hideously bloated body.

name: Manta Ray
description: While manta rays might appear daunting, they are generally docile.

name: Manticore
description: The manticore is a monstrous amalgamation of lion, dragon, and human with a penchant for feasting on human flesh.

name: Manticore Paaridar
description: Monks dissatisfied with the limits of their humanoid forms and yearning for a shortcut can steal the might from other creatures.

name: Mari Lwyd
source: A Caroling Horse (Of Course. Of Course.) pg. 0
description: Nethys Note: The Mari Lwyd is a creature from the 2021 New Years celebratory blog post.

name: Marid
description: Marids are capricious but powerful genies from the Plane of Water; among geniekind, they are rivaled in power only by the fiery efreet.

name: Marilith (Pride Demon)
description: Mariliths are the generals of the Abyss, formed from the souls of proud evil mortals, often warlords and despots.

name: Marrmora
description: On the First World, marrmoras dwell in ruined wildlands perpetually scourged by fire and rarely, if ever, travel elsewhere.

name: Marsh Giant
description: Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants are hideous in appearance indeed, with fishlike mouths, slimy gray-green skin, and dark, beady eyes.

name: Marut
description: A marut is tasked with hunting mortals who cheat death by artificially extending their lifespans.

name: Mastodon
description: Not to be confused with the larger mammoth, mastodons are primeval elephants who dwell predominantly in temperate forests.

name: Mechanical Carny
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 86
description: Mechanical carnies are constructs manufactured to serve as entertainers, cleaners, and guards at carnivals and circuses.

name: Medusa
description: Monstrous humanoids that resemble humans with snakes instead of hair, medusas are best known for their petrifying gazes that—if lingered upon—can permanently transform mortals to stone.

name: Megalania
description: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey.

name: Megalictis
description: These giant weasels are driven by the same hunger that plagues their smaller cousins, but because of their much larger size, they can quickly devastate the wildlife in an environment.

name: Megalodon
description: Prehistoric sharks of incredible size, strength, and ferocity, megalodons scour waters deep and shallow to sate their considerable hunger.

name: Megaprimatus
description: The megaprimatus is among the mightiest of apes, quick to confront any perceived intrusions into its domain.

name: Megatherium
description: Megatheriums dwell deep within ancient forests and humid jungles.

name: Meladaemon (Famine Daemon)
description: Meladaemons personify death by starvation and thirst, and revel in spreading the same despair that brought about their mortal demise.

name: Melixie
description: Melixies are hyperactive insect sprites with legendary sweet tooths, capable of drinking down honey, nectar, sugar, and other sweets in alarming quantities.

name: Melody On The Wind
description: This cloud of song and sound has been caught by the wind and carried across the air.

name: Merfolk Warrior
description: Merfolk warriors form the bulk of the militias of their vast underwater realms and meet potential aggressors head-on with uncompromising force.

name: Merfolk Wavecaller
description: Merfolk wavecallers use their primal power to call forth allies and defend their people with deadly magic.

name: Mezlan
description: The bizarre shapeshifters known as mezlans were created ages ago as spies and infiltrators by a long-forgotten ritual infusing a magically constructed ooze with the soul of an exceptional sapient being.

name: Mi-Go
description: Mi-gos are both scientists and colonists, yet their extraterrestrial nature and malevolent motives color their investigations with cruelty.

name: Millindemalion
description: Millindemalion are cruel fey tricksters capable of causing mayhem with their magical, mind-altering hats.

name: Mimic
description: Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects.

name: Minchgorm
source: Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale pg. 84
description: An oddity even among the strange creatures of the First World of the fey, the aquatic minchgorm is a monstrous alien maw ringed with writhing tendrils.

name: Minotaur
description: Minotaurs are master hunters that dwell in cunning labyrinths or tangles of underground caverns meant to disorient and demoralize prey.

name: Misery Siktempora
description: Creatures born of intense pain and suffering, the armless, six-legged misery siktemporas are some of the most numerous of their kind since misery is as ubiquitous an experience as living.

name: Mist Stalker
description: The tentacled mist stalker shrouds itself in a cloak of mist through which its single, never-blinking eye can see with clarity, allowing it an advantage when stalking its prey.

name: Mitflit
description: Mitflits, also known as mites, are self-loathing and pitiful cowards, easily bullied into servitude by other creatures or even slightly more powerful mitflit leaders.

name: Mithral Golem
description: Mithral golems are gorgeously crafted, silvery humanoids made from colossal amounts of the purest mithral.

name: Mix Couatl
description: Mix couatls (pronounced “meesh”) are guides to fledgling societies, providing fundamental information such as farming techniques, medicinal expertise, or more esoteric knowledge like the arcane arts.

name: Mobogo
description: Mobogos are massive, swamp-dwelling monstrosities that combine the worst aspects of giant toads and evil dragons.

name: Mohrg
description: The weight of murder wears heavy on the soul.

name: Mokele-Mbembe
description: Mokele-mbembes are large, reptilian predators found deep within Golarion’s jungles.

name: Mokele-Mbembes
description: Mokele-mbembes are large, reptilian predators found deep within Golarion's jungles.

name: Monadic Deva (Soul Angel)
description: Monadic devas stand vigil along the River of Souls as it passes from the mortal realm into the Ethereal Plane.

name: Monkey Swarm
description: A single monkey can cause mischief.

name: Monkey
description: When these small, curious primates come in contact with large humanoid populations, they quickly adapt, learning to steal food or small objects before retreating to the nearest tree branch with their prize.

name: Moon Hag
description: Moon hags are powerful soothsayers who dwell in places where souls receive their final judgment.

name: Moonflower
description: These enormous plants have thick, knotted trunks festooned with fanged blossoms.

name: Moose
description: Moose are a large, solitary type of deer.

name: Morlock Cultist
description: Morlocks who serve as priests in their conclaves usually dabble in eerie occult magic.

name: Morlock Engineer
description: Most morlocks have little talent for crafting, but a rare few have an uncanny knack for tinkering.

name: Morlock Scavenger
description: The morlock scavenger is a lankier, smaller version of a typical morlock.

name: Morlock
description: Originating from humans long lost from the world of light, morlocks are brutal monsters that dwell in the tangled tunnels of the upper reaches of the Darklands.

name: Morrigna
description: Bounty hunters and investigators, morrignas seek out creatures that thwart death or interfere with the natural flow of souls.

name: Mothman
description: Little is known of the strange creatures known as mothmen, save that when they make themselves known, calamity is sure to follow.

name: Movanic Deva (Guardian Angel)
description: Movanic devas are stewards of the flow of good creatures' souls through the cycle of life and death, from the point a creature is born to the day it dies.

name: Mu Spore
description: A mu spore is a thankfully rare fungoid monstrosity of vast power and strange intellect.

name: Mudwretch
description: In its resting form, a mudwretch looks like a large puddle of thick, dark mud, heaped at the center in a slightly drier patch of loam.

name: Mukradi
description: Fearsome centipede-like creatures, mukradis are three-headed predators with a devastating array of breath weapons.

name: Mulventok
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 79
description: Sinister fleshwarpers reshape captive urdefhans into these juggernauts of war.

name: Mummy Guardian
description: The majority of mummies were created by cruel and selfish masters to serve as guardians to protect their tombs from intruders.

name: Mummy Pharaoh
description: While mummy guardians are undead crafted from the corpses of sacrificed—usually unwilling victims—and retain only fragments of their memories, a mummy pharaoh is the result of a deliberate embrace of undeath by a sadistic and cruel ruler.

name: Munagola (Executioner Devil)
description: Munagolas are some of the most feared demonic warriors in Hell, combining the aerial strength and craftiness of erinyes with sheer brute force rivaling that of the strongest devils.

name: Munavri Spellblade
description: Although the subterranean Darklands are known for their cruel and domineering civilizations—led by fiend-worshipping drow, urdefhans, and others—that dwell within those sinister caverns, not every such subterranean society is ruled that way.

name: Muse Phantom
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 81
description: For performers who die before their time and whose love of the theater is stronger than death’s grasp, the show does indeed go on.

name: Muurfeli
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 78
description: Whereas typical djinn can cleanse or clear areas with their arcane winds, the air magic of muurfeli is tainted by the Black Desert's noxious radiation and mixed with the realm's ambient fetid winds.

name: Myceloid
description: The ambulatory fungus creatures called myceloids are notorious for spreading deadly purple pox, controlling creatures' minds, and devouring humanoid flesh.

name: Myrucarx
source: Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale pg. 85
description: The slithering, shapeless beings known as myrucarxes occasionally slip into the Material Plane from their domains deep in the Shadow Plane, seeking to torment those who love light.

name: Nabasu (Gluttony Demon)
description: Nabasus are birthed directly into the Material Plane from the Abyss, an invasive infestation that releases the newly formed and ravenously hungry demons directly into the midst of their favored prey: mortal life.

name: Nagaji Soldier
description: Nagaji are brawny bipeds with humanoid figures and serpentine heads.

name: Naiad Queen
description: Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered on untouched lakes or other bodies of fresh water.

name: Naiad
description: Naiads protect streams, ponds, springs, and other natural bodies of fresh water.

name: Najra Lizard
description: Among the smallest breeds of dragon on Golarion, these savage, cunning hunters dwell near the oases that dot the inhospitable Narhari Desert in Vudra.

name: Nalfeshnee (Boar Demon)
description: Nalfeshnees are huge, corpulent, boar-headed demons that hoard treasures and knowledge alike and form from the souls of avaricious mortals.

name: Namorrodor
description: Namorrodor stalk the night, craving the flesh of the living.

name: Narwhal
description: Narwhals are mid-sized whales known for the long tusk that grows from their nose.

name: Naunet
description: Pugnacious and powerfully muscled, naunets serve as scouts and rank-and-file troops of protean armies.

name: Necrophidius
description: Although the necrophidius is a mindless construct with no particular ability to comprehend the complexities of good or evil, these sinister-looking constructs are often crafted by evil or macabre creators seeking to imbue their guardians with a frightening aesthetic.

name: Nemhaith
description: This undead guardian stands amid a whirling swarm of shackled spirits that rage against their fate.

name: Nenchuuj
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 85
description: Nenchuujes embody the fear of magic corrupted, gone wrong, or spiraling out of control with unintended consequences.

name: Neothelid
description: This gigantic, mauve worm has a hooked mouth with multiple circular bands of teeth and four barbed tongues.

name: Nereid
description: Nereids are aquatic fey with deep ties to water.

name: Nessian Warhound
description: Believed to be bred by the Prince of Darkness himself within vast kennels in the infernal realm of Nessus, Nessian warhounds are the favored guards and hunting hounds of powerful fiends and, rarely, those mortals who worship them and have earned their favor.

name: Night Hag
description: Night hags are thieves and merchants of mortal souls.

name: Nightgaunt
description: Nightgaunts dwell in dreams, lurking in wait to spirit away the unwary dreamer.

name: Nightmarchers
description: While smooth roads remain a traveler's blessing, walking them after sunset risks nightmarcher attack.

name: Nightmare
description: Nightmares are flaming equine harbingers of death.

name: Nikaramsa
description: Lies, knowledge, and deception are a nikaramsa's stock and trade.

name: Nilith
description: The sleek, dark niliths resemble hairless, emaciated tree sloths.

name: Nixie
description: These aquatic fey often guard ponds, rivers, lakes, and springs, protecting their bucolic homes from the advances of predators and careless humanoids alike.

name: Norn
description: Ancient beyond imagining, norns are powerful fey women who hold in their hands the physical manifestation of fate and destiny in the form of golden thread.

name: Nosferatu Malefactor
description: Twisted by age and eternal hunger, nosferatu malefactors spread plague in their wake and yearn for mortal blood.

name: Nosferatu Overlord
description: Millennia of feeding on the living can turn the most powerful nosferatus into creatures of indomitable will and walking terror.

name: Nosferatu Thrall
description: Nosferatu thralls are mortals bound to a nosferatu's will.

name: Nosoi
description: A nosoi resembles a whippoorwill, sparrow, or other small bird wearing a heavy leather plague doctor’s mask.

name: Nuckelavee
description: When pollution despoils a natural waterway, it draws the dreaded nuckelavee to it from the First World.

name: Nucol
description: Representing the fear of parasites and affliction, nucols appear as violent, pestilence-ridden boars.

name: Nuglub
description: The "towering" hunchbacked nuglubs are among the largest gremlins, though they're not quite three feet tall.

name: Nyktera
description: Nykteras, or bat sprites, are gentle sprites known for their affectionate nature and incredible hospitality.

name: Nyogoth
description: Little more than a coiled mass of intestines encircling a massive gaping maw, this qlippoth is an Abyssal scavenger, subsisting on the filth and leftovers of demons and qlippoth alike, although it relishes any opportunity to consume living prey.

name: Obrousian
source: Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale pg. 86
description: Spawned from sorrow and hatred, obrousians are undead merfolk who lurk in shallow places to prey upon hated land dwellers.

name: Obsidian Golem
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 80
description: The art of golem animation is not limited to societies with access to expensive crafting materials or a long history of arcane mastery.

name: Ochre Jelly
description: Ochre jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, orange, and brown hues.

name: Ofalth
description: Found in castle dung heaps, city dumps, and sewers, ofalths are thought to be cousins of shamblers.

name: Ogre Boss
description: In ogre society, might makes more than right—it makes the rules.

name: Ogre Glutton
description: Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling.

name: Ogre Hurler
description: Ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and cruelty.

name: Ogre Spider
description: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants.

name: Ogre Warrior
description: The simplest of ogres are slabs of muscle with hatefully beady eyes, misshapen visages, and malformed bodies.

name: Oil Living Graffiti
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 84
description: A living graffiti is a painting or drawing that has come to life by way of strange magic.

name: Olethrodaemon (Apocalypse Daemon)
description: Even daemons fear the most massive and terrifying of their kind, olethrodaemons.

name: Omox (Slime Demon)
description: Seemingly made from living, animated filth, omoxes have no true anatomy, although they generally spend most of their time in roughly humanoid shapes, resembling some grim caricatures of half-melted humanoids.

name: Onidoshi
description: Onidoshi, or ogre mages, are oni with the material form of an ogre.

name: Ooze Mephit
description: Slick in every sense of the word, ooze mephits are unapologetic sycophants, shamelessly flattering anyone they may be able to con a favor out of, although their lack of intelligence and subtlety means that only the most vain or trusting targets fail to see through their honeyed words.

name: Orc Brute
description: If orc armies are rarely well organized, this shortcoming can likely be traced to the furious and undisciplined rank-and-file brutes who make up the bulk of an orc warband.

name: Orc Warchief
description: When orcs raid, the strongest is chosen as the leader, backed up by brothers, sisters, and other immediate family.

name: Orc Warrior
description: The typical orc warrior is a violent combatant familiar to many adventurers.

name: Orca
description: While many know orcas as “killer whales,” they are actually the largest species of dolphin.

name: Oread
description: Elemental earth laces through the bones of oreads, who appear similar to stone statues of their mortal ancestry, with delicate crystals in place of hair, fur, or scales.

name: Ostiarius
description: Ostiariuses, as emissaries of the velstracs, tend to the portals between the Shadow Plane and the Material Plane.

name: Ostovite
description: Skittering scavenger vermin common throughout the Abyss, ostovites roam battlefields to harvest flesh and bones.

name: Osyluth (Bone Devil)
description: An osyluth is an unparalleled inquisitor that revels in the sadism and torture for which Hell is so well known.

name: Otyugh
description: Lords of sewers, ditches, and landfllls, otyughs are   lthy monstrosities that stomp about on three massive legs in search of tasty garbage and refuse.

name: Ouroboros
description: Ouroboros are the embodiment of eternity.

name: Ovinnik
description: The ovinnik is the most ferocious of house spirits, and the only one that will kill if sufficiently angered.

name: Owb Prophet
description: An owb who comes into contact and is chosen by one of the Forsaken gains a fragment of that demigod's power and forges a permanent connection with it.

name: Owb
description: Commonly called owbs, or lesser owbs by more powerful owb prophets, most of these mysterious creatures focus on manipulating caligni culture.

name: Owlbear
description: With the body of a powerful brown bear and the keen senses of an owl, the owlbear is a dangerous territorial predator, fearlessly attacking any creature that strays into its domain.

name: Pachycephalosaurus
description: Pachycephalosauruses are normally peaceful herbivorous dinosaurs, but they grow much more violent during their mating season, when they fight one another to win over mates and warn away interlopers.

name: Pakalchi
description: Pakalchis strive to intensify their preys' inherent insecurity over personal and emotional bonds, playing on the threat of those relationships falling into ruin.

name: Palace Skelm
description: Skelms crave power, and the palace skelms who stalk the halls where such power concentrates are among the most dangerous of their kind.

name: Pangolin
description: Despite their prodigious size, giant pangolins are solitary, reclusive creatures who forage by night for insects and vermin.

name: Pegasus
description: The pegasus is a winged horse prized for its capacity to serve as an aerial mount.

name: Peluda
description: Peludas are wild and savage dragons that favor reedy marshlands, sparsely forested bogs, and river valleys for lairs.

name: Penanggalan
description: Penanggalans feed on the blood and entrails of the young.

name: Penqual
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 84
description: Although penquals are independent beings, each resembles a tight crowd of featureless humanoids pressed together in a mob.

name: Peri
description: Peris are contrary, artful celestials renowned for their beauty as much as their deceptive natures.

name: Peryton
description: The peryton is an amalgam of horror, merging the features of a stag, wolf, and hawk.

name: Petitioner
description: When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they are judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead.

name: Phantom Beast
description: The River of Souls, alongside the souls of dead sapient humanoids, also carries the spirits of monsters, animals, and other creatures.

name: Phantom Knight
description: Cavaliers and knights who died for their cause make for particularly strong-willed phantoms.

name: Phistophilus (Contract Devil)
description: Contract devils are clerks, scribes, and bureaucrats of Hell rarely found outside the infernal courts, and then almost always to pursue potential contracts, tempting mortals to sell their souls in exchange for achieving their worldly desires.

name: Phoenix
description: The phoenix is a primordial bird made of heat and flame that dwells in the most inhospitable regions of the desert.

name: Piscodaemon (Venom Daemon)
description: Scions of death by poisoning, piscodaemons are cruel even by daemonic standards, delighting in slow and painful suffering.

name: Pit Fiend (Tyrant Devil)
description: When an army of devils invades to bathe a region in bloodshed and hellfire, it is likely that one of Hell’s most powerful and diabolical generals, the pit fiend, masterminded the incursion.

name: Pixie
description: Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves.

name: Plague Giant
description: Plague giants are rasping behemoths, whose weeping sores, fetid breath, and filthy fingernails all bear a terrible wasting disease.

name: Plague Zombie
description: Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions.

name: Planetar (Justice Angel)
description: The beings of righteous fury known as planetars are known to be the least patient of angels.

name: Platecarpus
description: The mid-sized platecarpuses are the most common type of mosasaur.

name: Pleroma
description: Among the most powerful of all the true aeons, pleromas are a manifestation of the duality of creation and destruction.

name: Polar Bear
description: Polar bears are known for their pale fur, with black eyes, lips, and toe pads.

name: Poltergeist
description: When a creature dies, and for whatever reason its spirit is unable or unwilling to leave the site of its death, that spirit may manifest as a poltergeist: a restless invisible spirit that is still able to manipulate physical objects.

name: Popobawa
description: Cruel shapechangers, popobawas feed on negative emotions, particularly fear, despair, and anguish.

name: Poracha
description: Porachas are feline beasts native to the mystical Forest of Spirits in Tian Xia.

name: Porcupine
description: The porcupine, sometimes called a quill pig, is a shy, gray-and-brown herbivore covered in barbed quills.

name: Pranah Swarm
description: More teeth and fury than body, few fish command as much fear and anxiety as the piranha.

name: Precentor
description: Velstrac storytellers and historians are known as precentors.

name: Procyal (Raccoon Agathion)
description: As the most whimsical and playful of the agathions, procyals are the most likely to be encountered on the Material Plane, teaching deep philosophical lessons and delivering wisdom through pranks and impersonations.

name: Pteranodon
description: Pteranodons are quick and agile reptiles with 20-foot wingspans that enable them to hover on wind currents for hours.

name: Pufferfish
description: The pufferfish defends itself by filling its flexible body with air or water to extend a number of spikes that otherwise lie flat against its skin.

name: Pugwampi
description: Mean, dog-faced, and craven, pugwampis take disproportionate enjoyment from the accidents and missteps of other creatures—something that happens often due to the supernatural aura of ill fortune these gremlins project.

name: Pukwudgie
description: Pukwudgies go by many names in many regions, but those who know of them agree that defying their mischievous nature provokes their wrath.

name: Purple Worm
description: The purple worm is the most common and infamous of the cave worms, a much-feared monster wandering the twisting tunnels of the Darklands that is capable of carving out entire cave systems.

name: Purrodaemon (War Daemon)
description: Few creatures embody war's sheer amount of bloodshed and loss of life as deeply as the purrodaemons, deacons of war.

name: Quasit
description: Unlike other demons, quasits are formed when a mortal spellcaster sheds a portion of their own sinful soul to create a familiar or companion.

name: Quatoid
description: Quatoids are peculiar, mysterious elementals native to the Plane of Water that resemble four-tentacled octopuses with eerily humanoid faces on their mantles.

name: Quelaunt
description: This three-armed, three-legged monster has no discernible eyes, nose, ears, or mouth or no visible means of ingesting food.

name: Quetz Couatl
description: These sacred feathered serpents tirelessly serve the powers of law and good.

name: Quetzalcoatlus
description: Quetzalcoatlus are the largest flying members of the pterosaur family and are often mistaken for dragons due to their immense size and 40-foot wingspans.

name: Quickling
description: Few creatures can match a quickling's speed.

name: Quintessivore
description: Quintessivores are cunning creatures that wield arcane magic and scalpel-sharp spider limbs that can rend one's soul just as easily as flesh.

name: Quoppopak
description: Quoppopaks combine the most terrifying aspects of water striders, octopuses, and vampire bats into one evil, water-dwelling monster.

name: Qurashith
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 82
description: Qurashith—or “gluttonwings” in the Common tongue—are fearsome, bat-like predators that haunt the upper reaches of Gluttondark’s cavern-worlds.

name: Radiant Warden
description: The enigmatic and strange radiant wardens were constructed thousands of years ago to protect observatories and scholars against the incursion of alien aggressors from the Dominion of the Black.

name: Raja Rakshasa
description: When not disguised as a humanoid, the raja rakshasa has the head of an animal.

name: Raktavarna
description: The least of all rakshasas, raktavarnas resemble wicked serpents with glowing red eyes and oversized fangs.

name: Rancorous Priesthood
description: Followers of Rovagug must usually conceal their devotion to the Rough Beast, hiding in remote cave complexes or abandoned ruins; but they emerge from these strongholds when they sense weakness, gathering together into a destructive, homicidal mob to hunt down high-ranking priests of rival deities or slaughter entire towns.

name: Rat Snake Swarm
description: A solitary snake might be no cause for alarm, but a hissing mass of frenzied snakes can make even seasoned adventurers shudder.

name: Rat Swarm
description: A swarm of rats can cause total chaos within a household or business.

name: Ratfolk Grenadier
description: Ratfolk grenadiers use alchemy and stealth to defend their communities.

name: Raven Swarm
description: A flock of ravens is known as an unkindness.

name: Ravener Husk
description: Raveners require a steady diet of souls, and a ravener that's unable to feed for too long eventually cannibalizes their own soul.

name: Ravener
description: The ravener presented here was once an ancient red dragon.

name: Ravenile
description: Raveniles are rare mutant lizardfolk who exhibit monstrous strength and regenerative capabilities.

name: Raven
description: These omnivorous birds are cunning and opportunistic scavengers.

name: Reaper Skull Puffball
source: Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death pg. 79
description: When this fungus detects prey, its tendrils writhe and exude a paralytic toxin.

name: Red Fox
description: The shy and perceptive red fox has uncanny adaptability and is just as comfortable in urban areas as in the wilds.

name: Redcap
description: Redcaps are sadistic and capricious fey who thrill in bloodletting and murder.

name: Reef Octopus
description: The common reef octopus is a risky but valuable catch for coastal fishers.

name: Reefclaw
description: Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters.

name: Remnant of Barzillai
description: Though the Silver Ravens defeated the evil tyrant Barzillai Thrune before he could fully realize his goal of becoming a genius loci, remnants of his spirit remain throughout the Ravounel region.

name: Remorhaz
description: A remorhaz is an enormous arctic predator that resembles a multilegged insect with draconic features.

name: Revenant
description: Revenants are obsessed, undead stalkers who arise from their own murders and are driven by only one thing: revenge against their killers.

name: Rhevanna
source: Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege pg. 83
description: Rhevannas are hunters, binders, and devourers of celestials.

name: Rhinoceros
description: Rhinoceroses are short-tempered, territorial, and easily startled, and these traits combined with their innate ferocity means their natural instinct when disturbed is to attack.

name: Rhu-Chalik
description: The alien entities known as rhu-chaliks serve as scouts for a conglomeration of deep-space conquerors called the Dominion of the Black.

name: Riding Dog
description: Riding dogs types include larger dogs, such as mastiffs, wolfhounds, and huskies, and are bred often by halflings and gnomes to serve as mounts.

name: Riding Horse
description: This entry did not have a separate description for the creature.

name: Riding Pony
description: This entry did not have a separate description for the creature.

name: Ringhorn Ram
description: Ringhorn rams, named for the massive, curving spirals protruding from their heads, travel the plains.

name: River Drake
description: Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river fish, they are actually distant relatives of the black dragon.

name: Roc
description: Legendarily massive raptors capable of carrying off elephants as prey, rocs are typically about 30 feet long from beak to tail and have a wingspan of 80 feet or more.

name: Roiling Incant
description: Though many spellcasters can harness the forces of magic in a consistent manner, such power can't always be controlled, especially in the hands of reckless researchers, megalomaniacal villains, or untested novices.

name: Rokurokubi
description: Rokurokubi come into being when mortals are cursed for some misdeed, though often the one who bears the curse is not the one who committed the offense, but instead their child or spouse.

name: Roper
description: To all but the most sharp-eyed underground explorers, a roper appears to be nothing more than a large stalactite, stalagmite, or pillar of ice.

name: Rosethorn
description: These hardy mountain dwellers surpass their lowlander cousins in stubbornness and agility.

name: Rune Giant
description: Magically crafted and bred by ancient wizards, rune giants are anathema to and tyrants among their own kind, who were given power to command and magically control other giants.

name: Rusalka
description: These androgynous, river-dwelling fey delight in manipulating the emotions of those unfortunate enough to fall into their grasp, using humiliation to break their victims' wills.

name: Rust Monster
description: Found in lost dungeons, deep caves, and abandoned mines, rust monsters are a bane to any adventurers who rely on armor, weapons, or other metal items.

name: Sabosan
description: Sabosans are intelligent, bat-like humanoids who live in warm forests and drink the blood of other creatures, particularly people.

name: Sacristan
description: Sacristans are failures among the velstracs, creatures whose bodies and minds have been utterly broken by the velstracs' torments.

name: Salamander
description: Salamanders have serpentine lower torsos, but humanoid upper bodies with toothy reptilian snouts.

name: Samsaran Anchorite
description: A unique connection to the cycle of life and death defines the mortal lives of samsarans.

name: Sand Sentry
description: Shifting back and forth between a detailed likeness of a human and a muted and featureless bipedal form, this creature of pure sand moves with an eerie grace.

name: Sandpoint Devil
description: While some creatures have been fused to create a new entity that's graceful and beautiful, the Sandpoint Devil is the opposite.

name: Sard
description: An immense, gnarled, tree awoken with raw, primal power by one of the fey Eldest of the First World, this monster—one of the legendary Tane—skitters on huge, spidery roots and thrashes its branches as fiery lightning courses within its blackened bark, a living manifestation of the violent clash between ancient forest and stormy sky.

name: Sarglagon (Drowning Devil)
description: Sarglagons dwell in Hell's myriad waterways, lakes, and oceans.

name: Sasquatch
description: The elusive sasquatches dwell in the deepest, most remote and secluded tracts of wilderness.

name: Satyr
description: To a satyr, life is a party and everyone is invited.

name: Saurian Warmonger
description: These saurians adopt warfare as their primary role and greatest calling.

name: Saurian Worldwatcher
description: The longest-lived saurians favor introspection and take the long view of things—though this thoughtfulness should not be mistaken for weakness.

name: Scalathrax
description: These slippery, scaly horrors dwell in remote cave networks in the Darklands, preferring to nest in narrow fissures.

name: Scalescribe
description: Often seen at the sides of spellcasters, scalescribes are tiny, snakelike creatures with numerous hands that usually hold a multitude of fountain pens in various ink colors.

name: Scalliwing
description: Couatls are large, brightly colored serpents with feathered wings.

name: Scarecrow
description: A ramshackle collection of materials in a human shape, the scarecrow construct is indistinguishable from a normal scarecrow until it slowly creaks to life.

name: Sceaduinar
description: Strange creatures born from jagged crystals in the heart of the Negative Energy Plane, sceaduinar are fueled by its negative energy and driven to extinguish all life.

name: Scorpion Swarm
description: While a single scorpion is itself a menace, swarms of these vermin can be outright devastating.

name: Scythe Tree
description: Malevolent, vicious, and cruel, scythe trees pose as normal trees near deep forest paths, where they wait to slaughter passersby.

name: Sea Devil Baron
description: Unlike in many cultures, the highest-ranking sea devils are expected not just to wade into battle alongside their brethren, but to actively lead the campaign.

name: Sea Devil Brute
description: Physically imposing sea devils are equipped with some of the best weaponry the community can find, though most are happy to rend their foes using tooth and nail.

name: Sea Devil Scout
description: Scouts, among the lowliest (and most disposable) of sea devils, ply the inky waters of the ocean in search of aquatic prey, tread ashore to gauge landborne threats, or charge into battle with the advance forces of a greater sea devil war party.

name: Sea Drake
description: Long and slender, sea drakes have fins down the length of their backs and webbing between their talons, making them just as adapted for gliding through ocean waves as the skies above.

name: Sea Hag
description: Sea hags kill and eat fishers and sailors who come near their lairs, torment coastal dwellers with dark promises and vague threats, and enjoy the act of causing distress and discord in small towns.

name: Sea Serpent
description: These fabled beasts resemble massive snakes with long rows of finned spines down their back.

name: Sea Snake
description: These lithe snakes like to frequent the shallow waters of tropical seas.

name: Seahorse
description: Giant seahorses are bear-sized, docile versions of their tiny, more common cousins.

name: Seaweed Leshy
description: Calmer than most of their other botanical brethren, seaweed leshys are a tranquil, discerning breed of leshy.

name: Seething Spirit
description: Hatred so powerful it lives beyond the grave—this sentiment animates the ephemeral crimson apparitions known as seething spirits.

name: Seugathi Reality Warper
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 83
description: Seugathi reality warpers create and destroy inhospitable environments on a small scale by manipulating the forces of raw chaos.

name: Seugathi Servant
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 82
description: The most common seugathis spawned by neothelids are seugathi servants.

name: Severed Head
description: The most common beheaded appears simply as a rotting head, barely preserved by the magic that created it.

name: Sewer Ooze
description: These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

name: Shabti Redeemer
description: Cobbled together from broken bits of mortal souls, shabti are facsimiles of wealthy or powerful mortals seeking to escape punishment for their sins upon death.

name: Shadow Drake
description: Shadow drakes are typically among the smallest and least powerful of their species.

name: Shadow Giant
description: Shadow giants are fierce natives of the Shadow Plane, where they have dwelled in perpetual twilight for millennia.

name: Shadow
description: The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

name: Shae
description: Shae are wispy, tenebrous creatures native to the Plane of Shadow.

name: Shaitan
description: Hailing from the Plane of Earth, shaitans are proud and brazen genies.

name: Shambler
description: Shamblers are cunning carnivorous plants that resemble heaps of wet, rotting vegetation.

name: Shambler Troop
description: This shuffling mass of decaying flesh moves with dull but singular focus.

name: Shanrigol Behemoth
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 85
description: Shanrigols that grow with the additions of many living victims can become truly enormous in size and pose a greater danger in their expanding hunting territories.

name: Shanrigol Heap
source: Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil pg. 84
description: The most basic and common type of shanrigol is called, based on its general shape, a shanrigol heap.

name: Shantak
description: The imposing shantaks are far more intelligent than their bestial appearance would suggest.

name: Shatterling
source: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven pg. 84
description: Shatterlings have a fixation on mirrors that gives them a strange affinity for reflective surfaces.

name: Shaukeen
description: Perhaps the most perverse asuras of them all, shaukeens particularly delight in causing the downfall of those who give them succor, shelter, and most of all, schooling.

name: Shemhazian (Mutilation Demon)
description: Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims.

name: Shield Archon
description: Shield archons defend the fortresses of Heaven against fiendish incursions.

name: Shining Child
description: Shining children are wicked, enigmatic monsters that roam remote planes and untraveled corners of the universe in search of esoteric lore.

name: Shoal Linnorm
description: Shoal linnorms occupy rocky shoreline shallows and slither along lonely coastlines.

name: Shocker Lizard
description: These brightly colored reptiles share the rough size and pack mentality of guard dogs, roaming in small groups.

name: Shoggoth
description: Although even raving fanatics and doom-saying prophets desperately claim the monstrous shoggoth is nothing more than a drug-induced vision or a thankfully unreal nightmare, the truth is altogether more dire.

name: Shoggti
description: Shoggti travel to other planes in roving bands to capture and charm victims, bringing them back to the Abyss where they are enslaved for unknown—but no doubt insidiously evil—purposes.

name: Shoony Hierarch
description: For all their advancement in agriculture, horticulture, and animal husbandry, shoonies subscribe to a remarkably antiquated form of leadership; the role of hierarch is normally inherited, passed on to the oldest living child of the village’s previous hierarch.

name: Shoony Militia Member
description: If shoonies had their way, war would cease to exist altogether, but they know this isn’t likely.

name: Shoony Tiller
description: Nearly all shoonies in a given settlement are farmers, fishers, or foragers.

name: Shrine Skelm
description: The unquestioned authority that a priest wields, with influence over even the most intimate details of a congregation's lives, is the ultimate prize for a shrine skelm.

name: Shuln
description: Scourges of the upper Darklands, these enormous, mole-like monstrosities slice and burrow through solid stone with massive forearms and adamantine-strong claws.

name: Shulsaga
description: Shepherds of the Silver Sea, shulsagas patrol the Astral Plane to protect the nascent demiplanes that form there, warding off those who would usurp the demiplanes or despoil them with unwelcome philosophies.

name: Siege Shard
source: Pathfinder #157: Devil at the Dreaming Palace pg. 84
description: Sieges provoke lingering feelings of confinement and desperation.

name: Silvanshee (Cat Agathion)
description: Silvanshees are a stealthy and extremely inquisitive contingent of agathions who gather information about the mortal world for other agathions.

name: Simurgh
description: Desert-dwelling people consider the sight of a simurgh a herald to a lifetime’s worth of luck, and those who are unfamiliar with the majestic beast might mistake it for the avatar of a deity.

name: Sinspawn
description: Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins.

name: Skaveling
description: Hideous necromantic rituals give rise to skavelings, or ghoul bats, monstrosities that are not true ghouls but instead are specifically crafted undead creatures.

name: Skeletal Champion
description: These skeletons retain the cunning they possessed in life.

name: Skeletal Giant
description: The reanimated bones of giants make excellent necromantic thralls.

name: Skeletal Horse
description: Skeletal horses are sometimes used as mounts by other undead or monsters.

name: Skeletal Hulk
description: Huge giants and other enormous creatures make powerful skeletons.

name: Skeleton Guard
description: The most common skeletal minions are mere guardians.

name: Skeleton Infantry
description: This troop of skeletons was once a cohort of highly disciplined spear-and-shield infantry from an ancient empire.

name: Skinstitch
description: Skinstitches' hulking frames are made from flayed humanoid skin stuffed with straw and poisonous insects.

name: Skrik Nettle
description: The expansive skies of the First World are home to skrik nettles—delicate, bizarre-looking creatures that resemble large jellyfishes.

name: Skulk
description: The cowardly and lazy skulks live on the fringes of organized societies and steal from others without a second thought.

name: Skull Peeler
